1 〔変わらない状態で〕 as it is; as it stands; intact.
►そのまま　⇒そのまま
・このまま　⇒このまま
・あのまま　that way
・あのまま行ったら今ごろはアル中になっていたかもしれない.　If I'd kept on like that by now I might well have been an alcoholic.
►その作り方は昔のままである.　It's made just like it was in the past.
・その城下町は今でも昔のままの姿をとどめている.　Even today that castle town looks just like it did in the past.
・私は今のままでも結構幸せだ.　I'm quite happy with things the way they are.
・今のままでは希望がない.　The way things are, there's no hope.
・日本の政治は今のままでよいのか.　Is the Japanese government all right the way it is?
・立った[すわった]まま話す　talk ┏standing [sitting]
・生きたまま料理する　cook 《a fish》 while it's still alive
・元のままである　remain as it was
・(リンゴを)丸のままかじる　eat (an apple) whole.
►新鮮な野菜は生のままがうまい.　Fresh vegetables are delicious raw.
►電気をつけたままで眠る　sleep with the light on
・服を着たまま(で)水に飛び込む　dive into the water with one's clothes on
・家を現状のままで売る　sell a house as it stands
・靴をはいたままで　with one's shoes on; in one's shoes
・「まあすわりなさい」「このままで結構です」　"Sit (yourself) down."―"I'd rather stand, thank you."
・〔タオルを渡しながら〕 濡れたままでは風邪を引くよ.　If you stay wet you'll catch cold.
►現状のままにしておく　leave sth ┏intact [as it is]; let 《a matter》 rest; let sb alone
・事態をあるがままに受け入れる　take things as they are.
・部屋は私が出たときのままになっていた.　The room was just as it had been when I left it.
・建物は朽ち果てたままになっていた.　The building had been left to rot.
・肉親の証言はそのままには受け取れない.　The testimony of a blood relative will not be taken at face value.
►あるがままの人生　life as it is
・泥の付いたままのニンジン　a carrot with the dirt still on it
・自然のままの山河　mountains and streams as nature made them.
►どうぞ靴のままお上がりください.　Come on in with your shoes on.
・どうぞそのまま.　〔立たないで〕 Please keep your seat. ｜ 〔外套を脱がないで〕 Keep your overcoat on, please.
・彼はアメリカへ行ったまま帰らなかった.　He left for America never to return.
・その服は買ったときのまままだ袖を通していない.　That dress is just as it was when I bought it. I haven't worn it once, yet.
・〔引用文中の間違いに注記して〕 第二次大戦は 1943 年(ママ)に終結した.　World War II ended in 1943 (sic).
2 〔…のとおり〕 as…; according ┏to [as]….
►旅は足の向くまま気の向くままが一番だ.　The best way to travel is to go where your whims and your feet happen to take you.
►思いのままに生きる　live as one ┏pleases [likes]
・(人を)意のままにする　turn [twist] sb round one's (little) finger; turn, twist, and wind sb
・…のなすがままになる　put oneself at the mercy 《of…》; be left to the mercy 《of…》
・人の言うままになる　move at sb's beck and call
・ままにならない　be not as one wishes
・人生ままにならないものだね.　Life doesn't work out the way you want, does it?
・ままにならぬが浮き世の習い.　If wishes were horses, beggars would ride. 【諺】 ｜ Life is full of troubles.
・忙しくて付き合いもままにならない.　I'm so busy that I cannot find time for social life.
・命じられるままにする　do as one is told; do sb's bidding
・請われるままに委員を引き受けた.　I did just as I was asked and became a committee member.
►思ったままを言う　speak just as one feels
・見たままを話す　tell as one saw it
・聞いたままをお話しします.　I'll tell you exactly what I have heard.
►彼は感じたまま奔放に絵筆を走らせた.　He let his brush run freely, in response to his feelings.

・時間を守る　be punctual
・秩序を守る　keep peace and order

・秘密[沈黙]を守る　keep ┏the secret [silent]
・彼女は死ぬまでその秘密を守り通した.　She took the secret to her grave.
・秘密を守らせる　bind sb to secrecy
・自分のペース[やり方]を守る　maintain one's pace [continue to do things one's own way]
・医者の指示を守る　follow doctor's orders
・親の言いつけを守る　obey one's parents
・節度を守る　be moderate in one's habits
・トップの座を守る　hold onto the top position
・名誉を守る　maintain one's honor
・独身を守る　remain single
・1 人の男[女]を守る　be ┏true [constant] to one ┏man [woman]
・町はこの伝統を守るため, 後継者の育成に乗り出した.　To keep the tradition alive, the town began training successors.

まなぶ【学ぶ】 [ローマ字](manabu)
〔習い覚える〕 learn; 〔教わる〕 be taught; take ┏lessons [a course] 《in…》; 〔研究する〕 study; prosecute one's studies; 〔教訓を得る〕 draw ┏a lesson [《much》 instruction] 《from…》.

・失敗に学ぶ　learn from one's mistakes
・人類は経験に学ぶということがないらしく, 相も変わらず醜い戦争を繰り返している.　It seems that humankind doesn't learn from experience, because they continue to wage ugly wars on each other.

・彼女は大学で日本の古典芸能を学んだ.　She learned about Japanese classical performing arts at college.
・この一件には大いに学ぶところがあった.　We learned a great deal from this affair.
・この書物を読んで大いに学ぶところがあった.　I have gained a great deal of ┏information [enlightenment] from this book.
・世の中には本で学べないことがたくさんある.　There are many things in this world that cannot be learned from books.
・彼らから学ぶべきものは何もない.　There is nothing to be learned [We have nothing to learn] from them.
・明治の日本は西洋に学べと盛んに留学生を送り出した.　During the Meiji period Japan sent many students overseas to learn from the West.
・よく学びよく遊べ.　All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy. 【諺】

まね２【真似】 [ローマ字](mane)
1 〔模倣〕 (an) imitation; mimicry.
〜する ⇒〜をする, まねる.
►スター選手の髪型をまねする　copy the hairstyle of a star player
・「まねしないでよ」と言うと, 弟は「まねしないでよ」と言った.　"Don't repeat what I say!" I said, and my brother repeated, "Don't repeat what I say!"
►見よう見まね　⇒みよう
・鳴きまね　⇒なきまね２.
►彼は人のまねがうまい.　He is a ┏good [clever] mimic
►まねのできない技巧　a skill that can't be copied.
►まねをする　imitate; copy; ape; follow 《sb's example》; do [give] an imitation 《of…》; do a takeoff 《of…》; 《俗》 make like sb; 〔こっけいに〕 parody [⇒まねる]
・人のまねをする　follow suit; take a leaf out of sb's book; 〔猿が〕 mimic man; 〔オウムが〕 imitate human speech
・まねをする人　an imitator; a mimic; 《口》 〔人の真似ばかりする人間〕 a copycat
・兄のまねをして煙草を吸ってみた.　Copying my brother I tried smoking cigarettes.
►私のような貧乏人は金持ちのまねはできない.　A poor man like me cannot do what a rich man does.
2 〔ふるまい〕 action; behavior; manner.
►卑怯なまね　a cowardly act
・生意気なまね　《say [do]》 something impertinent.
►ばかなまねをする　act ┏foolishly [like a fool]; play [act] the fool
・ばかなまねはよせ! 銃を捨てろ!　Don't do anything stupid! Throw away your gun.
・乱暴なまねをする　behave rudely; use [resort to] violence
・お前に勝手なまねをさせるわけにはいかん.　I can't let you act so selfishly.
・しゃれたまねをしてくれるじゃないか.　You think you can get away with that, do you?
►これは一体何のまねだ.　What do you think you're doing?
・駅のゴミ箱の新聞を拾って読むなんてみっともないまねはやめて.　Plucking a newspaper to read from a station rubbish can! What disgusting behavior!
3 〔振り〕 (a) pretense; simulation.
►泣きまね　⇒なきまね１.
►おびえたまねをして「キャーッ」という　scream in mock fright
・死んだまねをする　feign [sham, simulate] death; play dead
・食べるまねをする　make a pretense of eating
・驚いたまねをしてみせる　pretend to be surprised.

・彼はジョッキを置くと満足そうにげっぷをした.　He put down his mug and gave a satisfied belch.
・彼女は私の返事に満足げに微笑んだ.　In response to my reply she smiled with an air of satisfaction.
►満足がいく　be ┏satisfied [pleased] 《with…》; find satisfaction 《in…》; derive satisfaction 《from…》; have one's satisfaction.
►彼はその結果を満足に思った.　He regarded the results with satisfaction. ｜ He was ┏glad about [happy with] the result.
►満足のいく　satisfying

►私は今のままで満足だ.　I'm satisfied with the way ┏it is [things are], now.

・「ご満足いただけましたでしょうか」「大変結構なお味でした」　"Did you find that satisfactory?"―"It had a delightful taste, indeed."
2 〜な 〔申し分のない〕 excellent 《equipment》; 〔十分な〕 sufficient; enough; adequate 《pay》; 〔適当な〕 proper 《steps》; due 《procedure》; 〔人並みの〕 decent 《dress》; respectable 《living》.
►満足でない　〔不十分な〕 insufficient; inadequate; 〔人並みでない〕 inferior; mediocre.

・田舎に住んでいると訪ねてくる人はまれだ.　When you live in the country visitors are rare.
・この事実を知る人は, 今やいたとしてもきわめてまれだ.　There are few, if any, people who know this fact.
・彼が本を開くことは, ないと言わないまでもきわめてまれだ.　He seldom, if ever, opens a book.
・そのような場所へ行くことはあってもまれだ.　I seldom, if ever, go to such places.
稀に　rarely; seldom; uncommonly; on rare occasions; at rare intervals.
►ごくまれに　very rarely; once in a long while; 《口》 once in a blue moon
・まれに見る天才　a person of rare gifts
・まれに見る大馬鹿者　an extraordinary idiot
・史上まれに見る大豊作　a bumper crop of a scale rare in all history
・この小説は近年まれに見る傑作だ.　It's a novel of a quality rare in recent years.
・条件がそろえば, まれにこのような現象が観察されることもある.　If the conditions are met, you can on rare occasions observe this phenomenon.

まるい【丸い・円い】 [ローマ字](marui)
〔円形の〕 round; rotund; 〔環状の〕 circular; 〔球形の〕 globular; spherical; 〔円筒形の〕 cylindrical.
►円い顔　a ┏round [moon] face [⇒まるがお]
・円い大きな目　big round eyes
・円いテーブル　a round table
・丸い石　a cobble
・背中が丸い　have a rounded back; be stooped
・丸っこい　roundish. [⇒まるっこい]
►地球は丸い.　The Earth is round.
・このハサミは刃先が丸いので安全です.　These scissors have a rounded tip, so they're safe.
・丸い卵も切りようで四角.　Soft words make the going smooth, harsh words make the going rough.
丸く・円く　1 〔形を〕 round; in a ┏circle [ring].
►円く切る　cut sth round
・カードを円く並べる　lay out the cards in a circle
・こねた粉を丸くまとめる　gather the kneaded dough in a ball
・見物人が芸人の周りに円く集まってきた.　Spectators gathered around the performer.
2 〔円満に〕
►まるく治める[まとめる]　smooth over 《a quarrel, a matter》; make [patch] up 《a quarrel》; settle 《a matter》 amicably; bring 《a matter》 to an amicable settlement
・まるく治まる　〔二人の仲が〕 become reconciled; 〔事件が〕 be amicably settled; come to an amicable conclusion.
丸く[円く]する　round; make round.
►目を円くして　《stare》 with wide(-open) eyes; with one's eyes wide open; wide-eyed
・みんな目を円くして驚いた.　They opened their eyes wide in astonishment.
・角(かど)を丸くする　round off the ┏corners [angles]; smooth down the edges
・体を丸くする　huddle oneself; be huddled up
・人々は寒さに背中を丸くして帰りを急いだ.　People hurried on home, their shoulders hunched against the cold.
丸く[円く]なる　1 〔形が〕 become round; round (off, out).
►〔犬・猫などが〕 丸くなって寝る　be [lie] curled up (asleep); curl (itself) up (in a ball); curl into a ball
・ハリネズミが丸くなった.　The hedgehog ┏rolled up [rolled itself] into a tight ball.
・〔一座が〕 円くなってすわる　sit in a ┏circle [ring]
・最近祖母の背中がずいぶん丸くなってきた.　Recently, Grandmother's back has become increasingly hunched.
2 〔穏やかになる〕 peacefully; amicably; smoothly.
►最近彼は人間が丸くなった.　He has mellowed recently.

まさか [ローマ字](masaka)
by no means; on no account; never.
►まさかというように見つめる　look at sth disbelievingly.
►まさか!　Surely 《not》! ｜ Impossible! ｜ You don't say! ｜ No way! ｜ You must be ┏joking [kidding]! ｜ What do you know? ｜ Says who? ｜ Well, I ┏never (did) [(do) declare]! ｜ The idea! ｜ Indeed!
・「あの人, 会社辞めるんだって」「まさか!」　"He's going to quit, they say."―"No! ｜ He can't be! ｜ You must be joking!"
・「まさか君一人で行くんじゃあるまいね」「まさか」　"Surely you aren't going alone?"―"Certainly not! ｜ What do you take me for, an idiot?"
・まさかそんなことはあるまい.　It is not at all likely.
・まさか火事になるとは思わなかった.　The last thing I expected was that there would be a fire.
・この川でまさかこんな大物が釣れるとはね.　I would never have thought I could catch such a big one in this river.
・減給ぐらいはあるかもしれないが, まさか首にはなるまい.　I might have my pay cut, but surely I won't be fired.
・まさか僕がガスの栓を締め忘れたはずはないんだが.　(You) don't tell me I forgot to turn off the gas!
・まさか金を貸せとも言えないじゃないか.　How can I ask him for a loan?
・まさかとは思うが, 本気じゃないだろうな?　No, surely you don't mean it. ｜ I'm sure you can't be, but you aren't serious, are you?
・「お宅の息子さんがやったんですよ」「まさかあの子がこんなことするはずありません」　"It was your son who did it."―"There's no way he could have done something like this."
・「あっ」「まさか忘れたなんて言わないだろうね」　"Oh!"―"Don't tell me you've forgotten."
・「私のせいだって言うんですか」「まさかそこまで言う気はないがね」　"Are you saying I'm to blame?"―"I wouldn't go so far as to say that."
・「まさかこれ全部僕がやるんじゃないですよね?」「そのまさかだよ」　"Surely this isn't all for me to do, is it?"―"It surely is."
・まさかの友は真の友.　A friend in need is a friend indeed.

◧マツ科　the pine family; Pinaceae. ▷pinaceous adj.
松材　(pine) deal.

まつ２【待つ・俟つ】 [ローマ字](matsu)
1 〔時を過ごす〕 bide; abide; (期待して) wait 《for…》; await; look forward 《to…》; watch 《for…》; be on the lookout 《for…》; (雌伏して) lie low; (覚悟して) expect.
►順番を待つ　(a)wait one's turn
・母の帰りを待つ　wait for one's mother to come home
・寝ずに[外出せずに]待つ　wait ┏up [in] 《for…》
・楽しみにして待つ　look forward to 《sb's letter, seeing sb》
・今か今かと待つ, 首を長くして待つ　be hardly able to wait; expect sb every moment
・機会を待つ　wait [watch] for an opportunity
・時節を待つ　bide [watch] one's time
・復讐のときを待つ　look forward to (getting) one's revenge
・判決の瞬間を待つ　wait for the moment of decision
・春を待ちきれずに　unable to wait for spring
・相手の出方を待つ　wait to see how the other side acts
・待ちに待った日　the ┏long-looked-for [long-awaited] day
・待ってましたとばかりに　as if one had been waiting for that moment
・待ち続ける　⇒-つづける
・待たせる　⇒またせる
・待たされる　⇒またせる
・待たれる　⇒またれる.
►私はバスが来るのを待っていた.　I was waiting for the bus (to come).
・その日は 1 日連絡を待っていた.　I waited all that day (long) for them to get in touch.
・どうぞおいでください. お待ちしています.　Please come. We'd like to see you. ｜ We're looking forward to seeing you.
・〔順番を〕 今日はあまり待たないで済んだ.　I didn't have to wait long today. ｜ Today I got it all over without having to wait very long.
・5 分ほどお待ちいただけますか.　Would you please wait (for) five minutes?
・待っても無駄だ.　It's no use waiting.
・少々お待ちください.　Please wait a ┏minute [little, bit]. ｜ Please give me a ┏moment [second, minute]. ｜ Please bear with me a moment. ｜ 〔電話〕 Please hold (┏on [the line]).
・お待ちしておりました. さ, どうぞこちらへ.　We've been expecting you. Please do come in.
・ここで待っててくれ. 動くなよ.　Wait here. Don't move.
・雨がやむのを待って出かけた.　We waited for the rain to stop before going out.
・あとは待つだけだ.　All there is to do now is wait.
・オーブンに入れたら後は出来上がりを待つだけです.　Put it in the oven, and all you have to do is wait for it to be done.
・いくら待っても返事はなかった.　I waited and waited, but never got a reply. ｜ No matter how long I waited, a reply never came.
・何分くらいなら待てますか.　How many minutes can you wait?
・もうこれ以上待てない. 出発しよう.　We can't wait any longer. Let's be off.
・これは注文してから半年待たないと手に入らない.　You'll have to wait for it for six months after you order it.
・この日が来るのを 10 年間じっと待っていたんだ.　I had been waiting patiently for this day for ten years.
・待ってました!　At last! ｜ So there you are!
・彼が死ぬと, 待ってましたとばかりに遺産目当ての人々がやって来た.　When he died, people turned up with their eyes on his estate, as if they'd been doing nothing but wait for that moment.
・〔碁などで〕 「待った!」「待ったはなしだよ」　"Stop!"―"No stopping!" ｜ "Not ready!"―"That's not allowed in this game!"
・待つ身は長い.　Waiting is tedious. ｜ A watched pot never boils. 【諺】
・待てど暮らせど彼女は来なかった.　I waited and waited, but she never came.
・彼女は夫の定年を待って離婚した.　She waited until her husband retired, then divorced him.
・チャンスは君を待ってはくれない.　Opportunity will not wait for you.
・君が許してくれるまでいつまででも待つよ.　I'll wait ┏forever [as long as I have to] for you to forgive me.
・彼は息子の成長を待たずにこの世を去った.　He passed away without waiting to see his son grow up.
・待てば海路の日和あり.　Everything comes to him who waits. 【諺】 ｜ It is a long lane that has no turning. 【諺】
・この先どんな運命が待っているか, だれにもわからない.　Nobody knows what fate is waiting around the corner.
・ここはしばらく待ったほうがよさそうだ.　It might be best to wait a while at this point.
・2, 3 日待てば値下がりしますよ.　Wait a few days and the price will drop.
・いつまで待てばいいんだ.　How ┏long [much longer] do we have to wait?
・待った甲斐があった.　It was worth waiting (for). ｜ The wait paid off.
・伏せ! 待て! よし!　〔犬に向かって〕 Down! Wait! Good dog!
・待て!　〔動くな〕 Wait (there)! ｜ 〔逃げるな〕 Stop! 《Thief!》
・ちょっと待てよ.　〔行くな〕 Wait a moment. ｜ Hang on. ｜ Don't go yet. ｜ 〔あわてるな〕 Calm down.
・〔相手の言葉をさえぎって〕 いや, ちょっと待ってくれ.　Now, just a minute.
・〔独り言で〕 待てよ. もう少し考えてみよう.　Just a moment. Let's think about it a bit more.
・書類の廃棄は明日まで待ってくれ.　Wait until tomorrow before you destroy the documents.
・返済はあと 1 日だけ待ってやろう.　I'll ┏wait [give you] one more day to pay me back.
2 〔望みを託す〕 put one's hopes in…; 〔ゆだねる〕 trust in….
►両々相まって　depending on each other
・…は論をまたない　⇒ろん.
►それは国民の良識にまつほかない.　All we can do is leave it up to the people's conscience.
・この点に関しては, 今後の研究にまちたいと思う.　As far as this point is concerned, I would like to place my hopes in future research.
・問題の解決は国の施策にまつところが大きい.　For a solution to the problem much is to expected of the government's measures.

まず【先ず】 [ローマ字](mazu)
1 〔最初に〕 first; first of all; before [above] everything; in the first place; to begin with; for [by way of] a start; for [as] a starter.
►まず…する　begin by doing
・まず…してから　after doing…first
・まず手始めに　for a start; to begin with
・まず初めにお断りしておきますが,…　To begin with, I would like to ┏inform [remind] you that….
►まずやることをやってしまおう.　First let's get everything done that has to be done.
・ではまず私からご挨拶申しあげます.　Er, I'll start the ball rolling by saying a few words.
・まずこの間の事情を説明しよう.　First, let me explain the recent situation.
・障害は多々あるが, まず第一には資金が足りない.　There are any number of obstacles, and in the first place is our lack of capital.
・親は何よりもまず, 子供の幸福を考える.　Parents put the happiness of their children before anything else.
・まずはこの問題からだ.　Let's start with this problem.
・まずは酒だ. 話は後だ.　Drink first. Talk later. ｜ Let's have a drink to start with. Then let's talk.
2 〔ともあれ〕 anyway; anyhow. [⇒ひとまず]
►まずまずの出来　a ┏fair [reasonable] result.
►買うかどうかは別にして, まずその品を拝見しましょう.　Regardless of whether I buy it or not, let me see the article anyway.
・息子もようやく身を固めたし, まずこれでひと安心だ.　Our son has finally (got married and) settled down, so now at least we can feel relieved.
・まずは一筆御礼まで.　Anyway, please accept my thanks (in this letter).
3 〔おそらく〕 about; nearly; almost; practically; tolerably; 〔おそらく…ない〕 hardly; scarcely; 〔概して〕 on the whole.
►まずそんなところだ.　That's about right.
・これならまず上出来と言ってよい.　This is done fairly well.
・それですめばまず上等だ.　The ending is reasonably satisfactory.
・彼ならまず学者としてやっていけるだろう.　I suppose he could manage quite well as an academic.
・うまく行くと思ってまず差支えないだろう.　You may be pretty sure that it will go well.
・彼が文句を言ってくるのはまず間違いない.　It's pretty certain [You can be pretty sure] that he will complain.
・成功の見込みはまずない.　Success is almost hopeless. ｜ Success can hardly be expected.
・感染のおそれはまずないと思っていい.　It is reasonable to assume that there is no chance of infection.
・そうなることはまずあるまい.　It is almost certain that it will not happen.
・あれほどの人はまずいない.　There are few, if any, like him.
・あの男が台所に立つことはまずない.　He seldom, if ever, goes into the kitchen.
・まずあれだけ言っておけば心配あるまい.　At least if you say all of that, there'll be nothing to worry about.

め２【芽】 [ローマ字](me)

►芽を出す[吹く]　put forth [shoot out] buds; bud; sprout; pullulate; 〔木が〕 burgeon; come [burst, break] into leaf; sprout 《its》 leaves; 〔草が〕 grow out; put forth [push out] new shoots; put 《its》 head above the ground

めいわく【迷惑】 [ローマ字](meiwaku)
〔面倒〕 (a) trouble; 〔うるさいこと〕 annoyance; 〔不便〕 inconvenience.
〜な troublesome; annoying; bothering; inconvenient.

〜する 〔困る〕 be troubled; have trouble; get into trouble; 〔不愉快な思いをする〕 be annoyed; 〔煩わしい〕 be bothered; 〔不便な思いをする〕 be inconvenienced.
►そのため私はずいぶん迷惑した.　It caused me much trouble.
・君のためにみんなが迷惑しているんだよ.　You're making a nuisance of yourself to everybody.
►迷惑至極　very annoying.
►迷惑がかかる　inconvenience [bother, trouble] sb
・集金が遅れては会社に迷惑がかかる.　Delay in collecting money will inconvenience the company.

・迷惑になる　prove ┏troublesome [annoying]
・人の迷惑になる行為　an annoying act; a nuisance
・お客さまのご迷惑になりますので　since it is a nuisance to other ┏customers [passengers].
►迷惑をかける　〔困らせる〕 trouble sb; give [cause] sb trouble; put sb to trouble; get sb into ┏trouble [mischief]; make trouble for sb; put sb out 《over a matter》; 〔邪魔する〕 disturb; 〔悩ます〕 annoy; bother; worry; cause annoyance 《to…》; 〔煩わせる〕 be [make oneself] a nuisance 《to…》; make a nuisance of oneself; 〔不便をかける〕 inconvenience sb; put sb to inconvenience; incommode; 〔時間上〕 take up a lot of sb's time
・大層ご迷惑をおかけいたします.　I'm sorry to be such a nuisance to you.
・大変ご迷惑をおかけいたしました.　〔面倒をかけたとき〕 I am afraid I have put you to a great deal of trouble. ｜ 〔相手の時間をつぶしたとき〕 I'm afraid I have taken up a lot of your time.
・人にさんざん迷惑をかけておきながら, あの態度はなんだ.　Where are his manners after putting me to such a lot of trouble?
►いい迷惑だ, 迷惑千万な話だ.　It is a nuisance. ｜ This is extremely annoying.
・そんな勝手なことをされては迷惑千万だ.　It is a real nuisance to be dealt with so selfishly.
・私の名前を出されては迷惑だ.　I don't ┏like [want] to have my name mentioned.
・なにしろ忙しかったのでそんな雑用は少々迷惑だったが, まあ, やってやったよ.　Since I was busy, such an odd job was a little bothersome, but still I did it for him.
・もしご迷惑でなければ明日お訪ねしたいのですが.　If it is not inconvenient to you, I'd like to call on you tomorrow.
・迷惑と知りつつ君に会長を頼みに来た.　I know you won't like it, but I'm here to ask you to be the president.
・人の迷惑も顧みない放置自転車が多い.　There are many bicycles abandoned by people who don't care if they inconvenience others.
・少しは周囲の迷惑も考えろ.　Consider a little the bother you're causing to people around you.
迷惑がる　be annoyed.
►権威の嫌いな彼はその受賞をむしろ迷惑がっている.　He's not pleased with the award since he hates authority.

・この文章からは環境問題に対する書き手の熱いメッセージが伝わってくる.　The passage conveys the writer's ardent appeal to people to respect the environment.
・そのサイトにはたくさんの激励のメッセージが寄せられた.　Many encouraging messages have been sent to the Web site.
►発信音のあとにメッセージをお願いします.　〔留守番電話の応答〕 Please leave a message after the beep.
・立ち枯れの木々は地球環境が危ないというメッセージを発しているのである.　The withered trees send us a message that the global environment is in danger.
2 〔声明〕
►メッセージを発表する　publish a message
・メッセージを交換する　exchange messages 《of friendship》
・メッセージを送る　send [communicate] a message
・メッセージを朗読する　read a message.

みえる【見える】 [ローマ字](mieru)
1 〔形や色が目に届く〕 〈人が主語〉 see; (目に入る) catch sight of…; 〈事物が主語〉 be seen; be visible; show; be in ┏sight [view]; meet the eye; be open to the view.

►ここから東京タワーが見える.　You can see Tokyo Tower from here.
・「そこから何が見えますか」「正面に三越が見えます」　"What can you see from there?"―"Right in front of me I can see Mitsukoshi Department Store."
・会員章は見えるところにつけなければならない.　Members' badges must be worn where they can be seen.
・よい席だから舞台がよく見えた.　They were good seats, so we could see the whole stage.
・君の頭がじゃまでテレビが見えない.　I can't see the TV because your head's in the way.
・審判からはボールが見えなかったようだ.　From where he was the umpire couldn't see the ball.
・〔撮影で〕 後ろの方, 顔が見えませんよ.　You there in back, I can't see your face.
・都会では天の川は見えない.　The Milky Way isn't visible from the city.
・その超新星は昼間でも見えるほど明るかった.　The supernova was so bright it was visible even in daytime.
・この手術であなたの目は見えるようになります.　The operation will enable you to see again.
・今日は朝から富士山が見えている.　Today Mt. Fuji has been visible since morning.
・金星はさっきまで見えていたがもう沈んだ.　Venus was visible until a little while ago, but it has sunk below the horizon.
・波間に陸地が遠ざかりやがて見えなくなった.　The waves carried us far from the land and soon it was out of sight.
・私は彼の姿が見えなくなるまで手を振っていた.　I waved until he was out of sight.
・左舷に塔が見えてきた.　A tower came into view to port.
・人影がちらと見えた.　I caught a glimpse of somebody.
・そのとき白い車が走り去るのが見えた.　Just then I saw a white car drive off.
2 〔発見できる〕 (be able to) notice; be noticeable.
►そんな小さなよごれまで見えるんですか.　Do you notice such tiny stains as that?
・この標識が見えないのかね.　Can such a large road sign escape your notice?
・「ほら, あそこに看板が見えるでしょ」「あ, 見えた見えた」　"See, there's the sign."―"Okay, I see it."
・私のペンが見えないのだがご存じありませんか.　I'm missing my pen. Have you seen it?
・自分の欠点は見えないものだ.　One doesn't notice one's own faults. ｜ We are blind to our own defects.
3 〔形や色が見分けられる〕 be able to see.
►はっきり[ぼんやり]見える　see ┏clearly [dimly]
・袋の中身が透けて見える　one can see what's inside through the bag
・よく見えるように太い字で書く　write in bold strokes so it's easy to read.
►めがねをかければよく見える.　I can see well wearing glasses.
・手元の文字はくっきり見える.　I can see the writing at hand quite clearly.
・猫は暗闇でも目が見える.　Cats can see in the dark.
・近眼で遠くは見えない.　I'm nearsighted and can't see far.
・真っ暗で何も見えない.　It's totally dark and I can't see a thing.
・日没でボールが見えなくなるまで練習した.　We practiced until the sun went down and we couldn't see the ball.
4 〔解釈される・推測される〕 seem; appear; look; 〔わかる〕 be understandable.
►年より若く見える　look younger than one's age
・偉そうに見える　look important.
►この絵はクジラに見える.　This picture looks like a whale.
・そんな服装だと子供に見えるよ.　Dressed like that you look like a kid.
・彼は大学生には見えない.　He doesn't look like a college student.
・その男はサラリーマンのように見えた.　The man ┏looked like [had the look of] a corporate office worker.
・彼女はうれしそうに見えた.　She looked pleased.
・君の考えていることが私には見えない.　I don't quite catch what it is you're thinking of.
・今の内閣は政策が見えない.　The policies of the current cabinet are undiscernable.
・計画の全貌がなかなか見えてこない.　I have trouble envisioning the plan in its entirety.
・こう見えても私は警察官だ.　Despite appearances I'm actually a police officer.
・こう見えても私も忙しい身だ.　It may not seem so, but I too am rather busy.
・こう見えても[そうは見えないかもしれないが]僕は大食いなんだ.　I might not look it, but I'm a big eater.
・彼はああ見えて意外に気が小さいんだ.　Despite his looks he's rather timid.
・あいつ, 例のことがよほど気になると見える.　He seems inordinately troubled by that matter.
・深夜の買い物客が多いと見えて, あの店は営業時間を延長した.　As it appears there are many late-night shoppers, the shop has extended its open hours.
5 〔確認できる〕 (痕跡が) see traces; (兆候が) see signs; (存在が) sense a presence.
►気配が見える　see indications
・反省の色が見える　one can see traces of repentance 《in sb》
・顔の見える援助　the kind of help that wears a face.
►この一輪の花に彼女の心配りが見える.　In this solitary cut flower one can see a mark of her attentiveness.
・この部分には修正の跡が見える.　One can see traces of revision here.
・君の仕事には工夫が見えない.　There are no traces of ingenuity in your work.
・彼の活動には衰えが見えない.　There is no sign of failing powers in his activities.
・景気回復の兆しが見え始めた.　We have begun to see signs of a recovering economy.
・北さんの名はこの名簿には見えなかった.　I didn't see Kita's name in this directory.
・最近お隣の奥さんが見えない.　I see nothing of our neighbor's wife these days.
・息子さんが見えないようだがご旅行ですか.　I see nothing of your boy. Is he traveling?
6 〔来る〕 come; 〔到着する〕 arrive.
►昨日はどなたも見えませんでした.　Yesterday not a single person made an appearance.
・上田先生が見えました.　Professor Ueda has honored us with a visit.
・森様はすでにお見えです.　Mr. Mori has already arrived.

・事故で右の耳が聞こえなくなった.　She lost her hearing in her right ear due to an accident.

・耳が悪い　〔聞こえにくい〕 can't hear very well; 〔音感がない〕 have a poor ear for music
・よい演奏をたくさん聴いて耳が肥えてきた.　I listened to a lot of good performances and developed an ear for music.
►人間の耳には聞こえない音　a sound that human ears can't hear
・女性の悲鳴が耳に飛び込んできた.　A woman's scream leapt to my ears.
・彼の声は(遠くて)私の耳には届かなかった.　His voice didn't reach my ears.

►耳の　aural; 【解・生理】 auditory

►彼女の耳は音楽[語学]に向いている.　She has a good ear for ┏music [languages].
・私の耳はまだ確かだ.　My hearing is still good.

►妙なうわさを耳にした.　I heard a weird piece of gossip.

耳に付く　catch one's attention.
►川の音が耳に付いて眠れなかった.　The sound of the river seized my attention and I couldn't sleep.
耳に留まる　hear sth that stays in one's mind.
►ラジオから流れてきた知人の名が耳に留まった.　I distinctly heard the name of an acquaintance being spoken on the radio.
耳に留める　listen closely.
►この話は耳に留めておいてくれ.　Listen closely to what I have to say.
耳に残る
►彼の歌声が耳に残った.　The sound of his singing voice stayed with me.
耳を疑う　cannot believe one's ears.
►その報告に私は耳を疑った.　I couldn't believe my ears when I heard that report.

5 〔披露する・見せつける〕 show.

・好意的な態度を見せる　show a receptive attitude

・どれ, ひとつ歌ってみせよう.　Okay, I'll sing you a song.

・彼がこうして立派に働いているところを両親に見せたい.　I wish his parents could see what a hard worker he is.

・あいつには痛い目を見せてやる.　I'll show him what pain is.

・待て! 今日こそは目にもの見せてくれる.　Hold it! You're going to get yours today.
6 〔装う〕 present an appearance of…; look.

・幸せそうに見せる　look happy

・赤いドレスは彼女を一段と美しく見せた.　Her red dress made her seem all the more beautiful.

7 〔診察や鑑定をしてもらう〕 have something looked at.
►病気[傷]を見せる　have one's ┏illness [cut] looked at
・骨董(こっとう)を専門家に見せる　have an antique looked at by a specialist.
►まだ医者に見せていないのか.　Haven't you had a specialist look at it yet?

・見せる試合をする　play a riveting game.

みとめる【認める】 [ローマ字](mitomeru)
1 〔それと分かる〕 see; witness; notice; find; sight; spot; catch [get] sight of…; discern; perceive; observe; 【海】 make [raise] 《land》.
►この似顔絵はだれもが原田さんと認めた.　Everyone recognized Harada in the sketched likeness.
・肺にはなんらの異常を認めません.　The lungs show no abnormal sign.
・暗やみに二つの人影が認められた.　I made out the figures of two people in the gloom.
・そうした傾向が著しく認められる.　Such a tendency is strongly in evidence.
2 〔受け入れる〕 recognize 《a request》; accept 《a resignation》; acknowledge 《one's fault》; own 《oneself guilty》; grant 《the truth of…》; confess to 《a bad memory》; 〔許可する〕 permit; authorize; 〔是認する〕 approve 《a measure》; sanction 《a usage》; admit 《a fact》; 【法】 receive 《the evidence》.
►あっさり認める　admit freely 《that…》; make a frank confession 《of a fact》
・しぶしぶ認める　acknowledge 《one's fault》 grudgingly; admit 《one's defeat》 with a bad grace
・子供をわが子と認める　own [recognize] a boy as one's child; avow a boy for one's son
・(親が子の)結婚を認める　approve (of) a marriage
・入会を認める　be granted membership
・発言することを認める　permit sb to make a statement
・誤りを認める　admit to (having made) a mistake
・自分が悪かったと認める　admit [allow, *concede] that one was wrong; admit [own, avow] oneself (to have been) in the wrong
・負けを認める　recognize that one is beaten
・現金を受け取ったことを認める　acknowledge the receipt of a cash payment
・世間に認められた基準　the received standard.
►そこまでは認める.　I admit as much.
・それは断じて認められない.　I absolutely will not recognize that.
・彼は強引に自分の主張を認めさせた.　He forced them to accept his claim.
・あなたには外出の自由を認めない.　I deny you the right to leave the house.
・わが社では通勤に新幹線を使うことが認められている.　At our company we are permitted to commute on Shinkansen trains.
・お子さんの写真を数枚撮ることをお認め願えませんか.　Will you permit me to take a few snapshots of your child?
・私は誤りを認めます.　I recognize my error. ｜ I stand corrected.
3 〔評価する〕 recognize 《sb's ability》; take 《full》 cognizance of 《the altered situation》; realize 《the justice of…》; appreciate 《sb's real worth》; 〔判定する〕 judge.
►努力を認める　recognize [appreciate] sb's hard work
・必要と認める　recognize the necessity 《of…》; recognize sth as necessary
・正直な人だと認める　give sb credit for being an honest man
・技量[才能]を認める　recognize sb's ┏skill [talent]
・認められる　achieve [earn] 《international》 recognition; gain recognition 《from…》; have [get] the credit 《for…》; come into one's own
・大いに認められる　receive [meet with] much recognition
・相当と認められる場合　when it is ┏deemed [thought] proper
・世に認められずにいる　remain in obscurity
・法的に正当と認める　give legal sanction 《to…》; legalize
・意見なしは承諾と認める　regard the lack of an opinion as consent.
►子供はだれでも親に認められたいと思っているだろう.　I think any child wants to be recognized by their parents.
・彼女は作家として認められている.　She is a writer of established reputation.
・彼はやる気十分と認めた.　I realized that he had a lot of initiative.
・この療法は昔からその効果が認められている.　The efficacy of this treatment has long been recognized.
・この研究によってその有効性は広く認められるに至った.　This study led to more widespread appreciation of its value.
・ゴッホは画壇に認められないままこの世を去った.　Van Gogh died without having been recognized by the art world.
・これは彼女の功績だと認めねばならない.　She must be given credit for this. ｜ This must be counted to her credit.
・すばらしい演奏で彼は実力を審査員に認めさせた.　His wonderful performance impelled the committee of judges to admit his ability.
・彼もその薬害の被害者と認められた.　He was recognized to be a victim of the harmful side effects of the drug.
・DNA 鑑定で彼らの親子関係が認められた.　DNA testing has confirmed that they are parent and child.
・証拠十分と認められた.　The evidence was judged conclusive.
・私は君の話が正しいと認めている.　I am satisfied that what you say is correct.

みとおし【見通し】 [ローマ字](mitooshi)

►先の見通しが利く　can see far into the future; be farseeing; be farsighted; have foresight
・どうもまだはっきりと見通しがつかない.　It is difficult to say how things will turn out. ｜ The ┏prospect [outlook] is still dim. ｜ I have not yet formed a clear view of the situation.
・いま失職したら将来の見通しが立たない.　If I lose my job now, prospects for the future will be dim.
►見通しのきかない政治家　a politician without vision.

・見通しを誤る　make an erroneous projection.

・両国は終結の見通しもないまま, もう 3 年も戦争状態にある.　The two countries have been at war now for three years and there is still no end in sight.
・見通しは明るい.　The prospects are ┏bright [good].
・景気の見通しは明るさを増してきた.　Prospects for the economy are looking up.
・見通しはさえない.　The future is gloomy. ｜ The prospects are discouraging.
・核兵器廃絶への見通しは暗い.　The prospects for abolition of nuclear arms look dim.

もし２ [ローマ字](moshi)

・もしテレビがなかったら, 世の中はもっと静かだろう.　Without television, the world would be a quieter place.
・もしそうでなければ　if it were not the case; if not; otherwise
・叔母が私の授業料を払ってくれた. もしそうでなければ大学へは行けなかった.　My aunt paid my tuition fees. Otherwise, I couldn't have gone to college.
・もしなんなら, もしよかったら　if you like; if it is convenient for you; if you do not mind
・もしよろしかったらこの部屋をご遠慮なくお使いください.　Please feel free to use this room, if you like.
►もしよかったらここでお茶でも飲もう.　Let's drop in here for a cup of tea, if you don't mind.
・明日もし天気がよかったらゴルフに行くつもりです.　I think I'll go golfing tomorrow if it's fine.
・もしもう少し暮らし向きがよかったらそんなことはしないだろう.　If he were a little better off, he would not do such a thing.
・もし外国から攻められたらどうするか.　What would you do in case we were attacked by some foreign power?
・もしあした死ぬとしたら, 君はどうする.　If you were to die tomorrow, what would you do?
・もし南極圏の氷が全部とけるようなことがあったらどうなるだろうか.　What would happen if all the Antarctic ice were to melt?
・もしもう少し注意していたらそんな危険な目にあわずにすんだだろう.　With a little more care, I wouldn't have met with such danger.
・もし費用を出してくれるのなら一緒に行ってもかまいません.　I don't mind going with you ┏providing [provided that] you pay my expenses.
・もし草木に花が咲かないとしたら自然はどんなに寂しいものであろう.　Suppose plants were not to flower, how dreary nature would be!

・あの店では品物が売れないで持て余している.　That store ┏is burdened with a large [has too large a] stock of goods which do not sell.
・うちの庭でトマトがあまり取れたので持て余した.　We had so many tomatoes in our garden that we couldn't eat all of them.

もてあそびもの【弄び物】 [ローマ字](moteasobimono)
a plaything; a toy.

もてあそぶ【弄ぶ】 [ローマ字](moteasobu)
1 〔持って遊ぶ〕 play 《cards》; amuse oneself 《with…》; take ┏pleasure [delight] 《in…》; 〔いじくる〕 play [fiddle, twiddle] 《with fire》; toy 《with edged tools》.
►ネクタイに指をからめてもてあそぶ　play one's necktie through one's fingers
・鉛筆をもてあそぶ　toy with a pencil
・言葉をもてあそぶ　play with words.
►彼女はテーブルのナプキン・リングをもてあそびながら話をした.　She fiddled with the napkin ring on the table as she talked to me.
2 〔慰み物にする〕 sport [toy, trifle, fool] 《with…》; make ┏sport [a plaything, a fool] 《of…》.
►人の気持ちをもてあそぶ　play on sb's feelings
・女性の愛情をもてあそぶ　play [dally] with a woman's affections
・女をもてあそぶ　toy [trifle] with a woman
・男をもてあそぶ　flirt with a man; twist [turn] a man round one's (little) finger
・男にもてあそばれる　fall prey to a man's lust; be seduced by a man
・運命にもてあそばれる　be ┏the puppet [a plaything] of fate; be the sport of fortune
・波にもてあそばれる　toss about in [be at the mercy of] the waves.

もてはやす【持て囃す】 [ローマ字](motehayasu)
1 〔ほめそやす〕 praise [extol] sb to the skies; go overboard 《for…》; talk much 《about…》; make [think] much of…; make a ┏lion [hero] of sb; lionize.
►もてはやされる　be lionized; be (much) sought after; be in much request; be made much of
・ピアノの名手として世界中にもてはやされる　be ┏hailed [acclaimed] the world over as a great pianist.
2 〔珍重する〕 prize; value; treasure.

もてもて【持て持て】 [ローマ字](motemote)
＝おおもて.
►彼は若い女性にもてもてだ.　He is ┏very popular with [idolized by] young girls.

もうてん【盲点】 [ローマ字](mōten)
1 〔網膜上の〕 a blind ┏spot [point].
2 〔気づかない点〕 a blind spot.
►法の盲点　a ┏loophole [blind spot] in the law; a legal loophole
・警察の捜査の盲点　a blind spot in police investigation.
►犯人は飛行場での保安検査の盲点をついてナイフを機内に持ち込んだ.　The offender took advantage of a blind spot in security checks at the airport and carried a knife onto the plane.
►その分野のことは私の盲点だ.　I have a blind spot ┏for [about] that kind of subject.

もてなし [ローマ字](motenashi)
1 〔客への待遇〕 treatment; reception; 〔旅館などの〕 service.
2 〔接待・ごちそう〕 welcome; entertainment; hospitality.
►懇切な[心からの]もてなし　《offer》 cordial [hearty] hospitality 《to…》.
►もてなしにあずかる　share [partake of] the hospitalities of….
►もてなしの上手[下手]な　hospitable [inhospitable]
・非常にもてなしの上手な人　a most hospitable entertainer.
►もてなしをする　＝もてなす 2
・酒食のもてなしをする　wine and dine sb
・もてなしを受ける　receive hospitality
・心からのもてなしを受ける　be received ┏warmly [cordially]; be ┏given [accorded] a ┏warm [cordial, hospitable] reception
・茶菓のもてなしを受ける　be served tea and cakes; be entertained with (light) refreshments
・あたたかいもてなしを感謝する　thank sb for his warm ┏reception [hospitality].
►何のおもてなしもせず失礼しました.　I am ┏sorry [afraid] I have not been much of a host to you.

もてなす [ローマ字](motenasu)
1 〔取り扱う〕 treat; receive.
►厚くもてなす　treat [do] sb ┏well [handsomely]; receive sb warmly.
2 〔歓待・接待する〕 entertain; show [give] sb hospitality; be hospitable to sb; make sb welcome.
►大いにもてなす　lavish hospitality to sb
・厚くもてなす　give sb warm hospitality; entertain sb cordially
・山海の珍味で客をもてなす　entertain a guest with all sorts of delicacies
・音楽でもてなす　entertain sb with music
・手料理でもてなす　entertain sb with [offer sb] dishes one has prepared oneself [one's own home cooking].

モーテル [ローマ字](mōteru)
〔自動車で乗り入れるラブホテル〕 a "love hotel" that a couple can drive to; 〔自動車旅行者用ホテル〕 a motel; a motor [an auto] court.

もてる１【持てる】 [ローマ字](moteru)
〔資産を持つ〕 propertied; possessing property.
►持てる者　the haves
・持てる階級　the propertied classes
・持てる国　the haves; a "have" nation
・持てる者と持たざる者　the haves and the have-nots.

もてる２ [ローマ字](moteru)
〔もてはやされる〕 be made much of; be welcomed; be ┏warmly [cordially] received; have a warm reception; be talked much of; be lionized; 〔人気がある〕 be popular 《with [among]…》; be in favor 《with…》; be a favorite 《with…》.
►若い女にもてる　be ┏popular with [loved by] young women
・女性にとてももてる男　a man very popular with women; a ┏ladies' [lady's] man
・生徒にもてる教師　a teacher (who is) popular ┏with [among] students
・もてない　be not welcomed; be unwelcome; be given a cold shoulder; 〔人気がない〕 be unpopular
・女性にもてない男　a man unpopular with women.
►きれいな女の子は大いにもてる.　Pretty girls receive much attention.
・小池はそのパーティーで大いにもてていた.　Koike was having a great success at the party.

モテル [ローマ字](moteru)
＝モーテル.

モテット [ローマ字](motetto)
【音楽】 a motet.

モティーフ [ローマ字](motīfu)
＝モチーフ.

もうとう【毛頭】 [ローマ字](mōtō)
〔少しも〕 《not》 (in) the least; 《not》 at all; 《not》 a straw; 《not》 a bit. [⇒みじん]
►毛頭疑いない.　There is not ┏the least [a shadow of] doubt.
・毛頭異存ありません.　I don't have the slightest objection (to it).
・彼女を悪く言うような気持ちは毛頭ない.　I haven't the slightest intention of speaking ill of her.

もと１【下】 [ローマ字](moto)
►ぎらぎら輝く太陽の下　under the ┏glaring [dazzling] sun.
►…の下に, …の下で　〔(物の)下で〕 under…; 〔…を受けて〕 under…; 〔…に基づいて〕 on…; under…; 〔(先生に)ついて〕 under…
・…の指揮[指導, 監督]の下に　under the ┏command [direction, supervision] of…; under…
・…という約束の下に　on the promise that…; 〔条件で〕 on condition that…
・自由と平等の名の下に反体制運動を起こす　launch [start] an antiestablishment movement in the name of freedom and equality
・一撃の下に倒す　knock sb down [floor sb] at [with] one blow.
►法の下の平等　equality under the law.

もと２【元・本・許・基・因・素】 [ローマ字](moto)
1 【元】 〔はじめ〕 the beginning; the genesis 《pl. -ses》; the origin (略: orig.); the rise.
►元は　originally; at first
・元から　from the ┏first [beginning, outset]; originally
・…が元である　originate ┏in [from]…; arise [rise] from…; start ┏from [with]….
►元の　original; pristine
・元のままの状態で　in 《its》 ┏integrity [original condition]
・道路の幅が元の 2 倍になった.　The road has become twice as wide as it was before.
・本を元のところに置く　put a book back ┏in its place [where it was]
・その絵は元の状態に復元された.　That picture has been restored to its original condition.
►あの人のことは元から信頼のおける人だと思っていました.　I have always thought he is a trustworthy man.
・その会社は元は町工場からささやかに始まった.　The company had its modest beginning in a humble backstreet workshop.
・その梁(はり)は太い丸太で, 元は古い帆船のものだった.　The beam was a thick log, which came out of some old sailing ship.
・元はと言えばみな君の怠慢から起こったことだ.　All this resulted from your negligence.
2 【元】 〔根本〕 the foundation; the basis 《pl. -ses》; 〔根元〕 the source.
►製造元　the manufacturer; the maker
・火の元　＝ひもと.
►元が悪いのはいくら化粧してもだめだ.　If what you start out with isn't good, no matter how much makeup you put on, it's no use.
►元から絶つ　cut off 《the evil》 at its source
・病巣を元から絶つ外科手術　surgery to remove a lesion at its source.
►「ぞうさん」の歌を元にした替え歌　a song adapted from the children's song "The Elephant."
►水道[ガス]の元を止める　turn the ┏water [gas] off at the main
・川の元を尋ねる　trace a river ┏to [as far as] its source.
►無知は傲慢の元.　Ignorance is the mother of impudence. 【諺】
・この慣習の元は儒教にある.　This custom ┏originated in [derives its origin from] Confucianism.
3 【本】 〔基本〕 a foundation; a basis.
►農は国の本.　Agriculture is the foundation of the state.
4 【元】 〔下のほうやくっついている所に近い部分〕 ((木の)根本) the root 《of a tree》; (元込め銃の銃尾) the breech.
►元が枯れる　《potted plants》 wither at the roots.
►元のほうを持つ　hold 《a stick》 at the end.
►バットの元を上にして立てる　stand [balance] a baseball bat grip end up.
5 【許・元】 〔そば〕 one's side.
►親許　one's [one's parents'] home.
►師匠の許で修業する　study with one's teacher.
►…の許に　at…; with…
・叔父の許にいる　stay [live] with one's uncle; live at one's uncle's
・その知らせを聞いて彼女の許に駆けつけた.　I ran to her side at that news.
►父母の許を離れる　leave ┏home [one's parental roof]; go out into the world
・山田さんの許を辞する　leave Mr. Yamada's (house).
6 【基】 〔根拠・基礎〕 a basis 《pl. bases》; ground(s); authority.
►…を基にして　on the basis of…
・調査資料を基にして意見を述べる　express one's opinion based on the findings
・コンピューターのデータを基にして事故原因を調べる　investigate the cause of the accident on the basis of (the) computer data
・何を基にそんなことを言うのですか.　In what ┏grounds [authority] do you say so?
►…の基を築く　lay the foundation(s) 《of…》; lay the groundwork 《for…》.
7 【因】 〔原因〕 the cause; the origin.
►けんか[失敗]のもと　the cause of ┏a quarrel [one's failure].
►…がもとで　originating in…
・冗談がもとでけんかになった.　The quarrel began in a joke.
・風邪がもとで肺炎になることがある.　A cold may ┏develop into [result in] pneumonia.
・彼は深酒がもとで若死にした.　Too much drinking ┏caused his early death [brought him to an early grave].
►不潔は病気のもとになる.　Dirtiness [Uncleanliness] causes [brings on, leads to, gives rise to] disease.
►あなたの失敗のもとは不注意にあるのだ.　Your failure is ┏due [attributable] to carelessness. ｜ Carelessness is responsible for your failure.
・ぜいたくは貧乏のもと.　Luxury prepares the way ┏to [for] poverty.
・その混乱のもとは情報不足であった.　The confusion originated in lack of information.
・口は災いのもと　⇒くち.
8 【素】 〔原料・下地〕 (raw) material(s); a base.
►プリンのもと　an instant pudding mix
・市販されているケーキのもと　a commercial premix for a cake batter
・スープのもと　〔即席スープ〕 instant soup; 〔スープの下地〕 (soup) stock.
►酒は米をもとにして造る.　Sake production starts with rice. ｜ Rice is the ┏basis [starting point] for making sake.
►このスープはよいもとを使ってある.　A tasty stock is used in this soup.
・〔酒造りで〕 もとを仕込む　〔酵母を入れる〕 introduce the yeast.
►みそのもとは大豆だ.　Miso is made from soybeans.
9 【元】 〔資本〕 capital; 〔元金〕 the principal; 〔元値〕 the ┏cost [prime] price. [＝もとで, もとね]
►元がかかる　need [require] capital [an initial outlay]
・この事業は元がかかっている.　This enterprise ┏required [involved] a large capital outlay.
・元が切れる　be unable to cover the cost.
►元をかける　lay out money 《on…》; put [sink] money 《in…》; invest capital 《in an enterprise》
・元を取る　earn as much as the capital invested; recover [recoup] one's ┏investment [outlay]; get one's money's worth
・元を取れない　fail to return the original investment
・それでは元を取れない.　Then I shall be unable to recover the cost.
・その店は元を取れないうちに倒産した.　The store went under before it recouped the (original) outlay.
・元を切って売る　sell with loss on cost; sell below cost; sell under prime cost.
►この新薬は 3 年未満では元は取れないだろう.　This new medicine won't ┏earn [pay off] its cost in less than three years.
・この機械ではすでに元は何倍も取れている.　This machine has paid for itself several times (over).
10 【元】 〔以前〕
►元(は)　formerly; once; before
・元から　from the first
・元茨城県知事　the ex-Governor of Ibaraki Prefecture
・元京都大学教授吉村博士　Dr. Yoshimura, a former professor at Kyoto University
・元代議士　a former member of the Diet
・元総理　a ┏one-time [former] Prime Minister
・元俳優の政治家　an actor-turned-politician
・元市役所だった建物　the building that used to be the municipal office.
►読んだ本を元に戻す　return a book to where ┏it was (before) [it belongs, I'd got it].
►元の　former; past; ex-; sometime; old-time; one-time; erstwhile; 《文》 quondam; now defunct; 〔退職した〕 retired (略: ret.); 〔昔の〕 of former days; of old days
・彼の元の家　the house where he used to live
・彼女の元の夫　her former husband; 《口》 her ex
・元のままにしておく　leave sth as it was
・私の元の教え子たち　my former pupils
・元の席に着く　resume one's seat
・元の敵　one's ┏former [erstwhile] enemy
・元のとおり　＝もとどおり
・どうやら元のような体になってきた.　I'm beginning to feel (like) my old self again.
・元の自分ではないような気がした.　I didn't seem to be I ┏was [used to be]. ｜ I feel myself (to be) quite another man.
・作業が終わった者は直ちに元の位置に戻りなさい.　Those who have finished their work, return to ┏their original position [where they were before].
・経営方針を元の路線に戻す　get the business strategy back onto its previous track.
►元来た道を戻った.　We went back the way we had come.
・元うちの庭の真ん中に大きな桐の木があった.　There used to be a big paulownia in the center of my garden.
・このブーツは元は若い女性によく売れたものだ.　There boots used to sell well among young women.
・祖母は元はとても美人だった.　My grandmother was very beautiful in her time.
・してしまったことは元へは戻らない.　What's done cannot be undone.
・彼女の視力は元へは戻らなかった.　Her sight was never restored.
11 【元】 〔以前の姿; 素性〕 one's origin; one's antecedents.
►元を調べる　trace sth to its origin
・元をただす　inquire into sb's ┏past [precedents]
・元をただせば　originally; in its origin
・彼女の家系は元をただせば江戸後期までさかのぼることができる.　Her origins can be traced back to the late Edo period.
・あの人たちは元をただせば京都の旧家の出です.　They originally come from an old family in Kyoto.
・彼は元をただせば暴走族のリーダーだ.　He was formerly the boss of a motorcycle gang.
元のさやに納まる　get back together; be reconciled 《with her former husband》.
►前の夫のほうがわびを入れて結局二人は元のさやに納まった.　The pair were eventually reconciled after the woman's former husband made an apology.
元の木阿弥(もくあみ)　(a) relapse.
►元の木阿弥になる　lose all (that) one has gained; be (right) back where one started
・両親が残してくれた財産をすべて使い果たし, また元の木阿弥だ.　I spent all the money my parents left me, and I am as ┏pinched for money [hard-up] as I was before.
元も子もない　〈人が主語〉 lose everything; 〈物が主語〉 come to nothing; be wasted.
►お母さんの介護疲れであなたが倒れてしまっては元も子もない.　If you drop from exhaustion tending your aged mother, it's all over for both of you.
・元も子もなくなる　lose both principal and interest; suffer a total loss
・彼女の無責任な発言で 1 年ものわれわれの努力が元も子もなくなった.　Her irresponsible remark meant that our year's hard work ┏went [disappeared] down the drain.

・元俳優の政治家　an actor-turned-politician
・元市役所だった建物　the building that used to be the municipal office.

►元の　former; past; ex-; sometime; old-time; one-time; erstwhile; 《文》 quondam; now defunct; 〔退職した〕 retired (略: ret.); 〔昔の〕 of former days; of old days
・彼の元の家　the house where he used to live
・彼女の元の夫　her former husband; 《口》 her ex

・私の元の教え子たち　my former pupils

・元の自分ではないような気がした.　I didn't seem to be I ┏was [used to be]. ｜ I feel myself (to be) quite another man.

►元来た道を戻った.　We went back the way we had come.
・元うちの庭の真ん中に大きな桐の木があった.　There used to be a big paulownia in the center of my garden.
・このブーツは元は若い女性によく売れたものだ.　There boots used to sell well among young women.
・祖母は元はとても美人だった.　My grandmother was very beautiful in her time.
・してしまったことは元へは戻らない.　What's done cannot be undone.
・彼女の視力は元へは戻らなかった.　Her sight was never restored.

・祖母は元はとても美人だった.　My grandmother was very beautiful in her time.
・してしまったことは元へは戻らない.　What's done cannot be undone.

►もっともなことを言う　talk [speak] sense [reason]

►ごもっとも.　⇒ごもっとも

・あなたが彼の結婚の申し込みを受け入れなかったのはもっともだ.　It was sensible of you [You were right] to refuse his offer of marriage.
・あなたがそう言うのももっともだ.　You may well say so.
・彼の言い分はもっともだ.　What he says ┏stands to sense [makes (good) sense]. ｜ There is a good case for his saying so.
・彼が怒ったのももっともだ.　He had ┏good [every] reason to get angry. ｜ It's quite understandable that he should have got angry.
・彼が不平を言うのはもっともだ.　He complains, and ┏with (good) reason [for good reason].
・彼の行動はこれらの理由からしてまったくもっともだ.　His conduct is amply justified on these grounds.
・若い人が新しいものを望むのはもっともなことだ.　It is ┏quite [only] natural for young people to crave for new things.
2 〔とは言うものの〕
►もっとも例外はある.　There are, indeed, some exceptions to this.
・うちの息子はよくけがをする. もっとも大したけがではないが.　My son often gets hurt. It's never anything very bad, though.
・政治家は選挙でいろいろ約束をする. もっとも実現した例は少ないが.　Politicians make lots of election promises. Mind you, they seldom carry them out.
・彼女は歌が好きだと言っている. もっともうまいこともうまい.　She says she likes singing, and, in fact, she is a good singer.
・そういう校則があるのを知っていた学生はほとんどいなかった. もっとも, 教員も同様だったが.　Few students―or teachers, for that matter―knew about that school regulation.

・あのことで君に感謝されるというのも妙なものだ.　Strange that you should feel grateful to me for that.
・君は妙な鉛筆の持ち方をするね.　You have a queer way of holding your pencil.
・この料理, なんだか妙な味だね.　Doesn't this food taste strange?
・突然彼女は妙な行動に出た.　She suddenly began acting bizarre.
・妙なことにならなければよいが.　I hope something weird doesn't happen.
►どうも話が妙だ.　Now isn't that strange?
・彼が来ないとは妙だ.　It's odd that he's not coming.
2 〔すばらしいこと〕 a mystery; a miracle; a wonder; 〔巧みであること〕 cleverness; adroitness.
►自然の妙　the mysteries of nature
・造化の妙　the mystery of ┏nature [creation]; the wisdom of the creator.
►…に妙を得ている　be clever 《at [in]…》; be adept 《in…》; be skillful 《in…》; have a knack 《of…》; know the secret 《of…》
・彼は絵の色づかいに妙を得ている.　He has an ethereal sensitivity to color in his paintings.
►汗を流して集中できるところがスポーツの妙だ.　The wonderful thing about sports is that you can pour sweat and concentrate on something.
・言い得て妙だ.　Admirably put!
妙に　strangely.
►妙に聞こえる[見える]　sound [look] strange [funny]
・妙に思う　think 《it》 ┏strange [queer]
・妙に静かだ.　It's so strangely quiet.
・彼女のことが妙に気にかかった.　I felt anxious about her, though I knew not why.
・あいつ, 妙に張り切ってるな.　Isn't it odd that he's so intent on what he's doing?
・図々しいやつだが妙に憎めないところがある.　He takes advantage of you, but for some reason you don't hold it against him.

長くなる　get [grow, become] longer; lengthen; be made longer; be extended; be lengthened; 〔日などが〕 lengthen; draw out; 〔長引く〕 be protracted; 〔丈がのびる〕 lengthen; get [grow] longer; extend; 〔寝そべる〕 lie down; lie at full length.

・犯人たちは守衛を仲間に引き入れた.　The criminals won over the guard.

►仲間を募る　invite (new) people 《to join a club》; recruit new members 《to a club》

►同じ仲間じゃないか. 困ったときは言ってくれ.　Let me know if you need ┏someone to help [a helping hand]. We're ┏pals [teammates, colleagues], aren't we?
・あんなやつは俺たちの仲間じゃない.　He's no friend of ours.
・君もその仲間だろう.　I imagine you're in (it) with them. ｜ I suppose you're one of their number.

►蛾(が)の仲間　a member of the moth family

►この業界は仲間意識が強い.　There's a strong sense of camaraderie in this business.

►仲間喧嘩する　quarrel among ┏themselves [ourselves].

►仲間付き合いをする　associate (oneself) 《with…》; be ┏friends [pals] 《with…》; keep company 《with…》; 《口》 pal around 《with…》
・そのボランティア・グループとはここ 10 年来の仲間付き合いをしている　We have been associated with that volunteer ┏association [group] for the past ten years.
仲間同士　friends; coworkers; comrades; associates.
►入札前に仲間同士で談合したらしい.　They appear to have agreed among themselves (to fix prices) before ┏putting in tenders [bidding].
仲間値段　a trade price; an inside price.
仲間売買　trade sales.

►仲間外れにされる[なる]　be excluded; be left out (in the cold); be left out of 《the game》; be shunned; be treated as an outsider; 〔村八分になる〕 be ostracized; be blackballed; ᐦbe sent to Coventry.

►仲間ぼめする　speak highly of the work of one's ┏friend [colleague]; 《口》 logroll
・仲間ぼめしたって始まらない.　It's no use [There's no point in] patting one another on the back. ｜ What good does it do to be patting one another on the back?

・犬が鳴く　〔わんわん〕 bark; 〔きゃんきゃん〕 whine; 〔猟犬が〕 bay; 〔子犬が〕 yelp
・猫が鳴く　meow; mew

・ロバが鳴く　bray

・アザラシが鳴く　honk

・雌鶏(めんどり)が鳴く　cluck; cackle

・七面鳥などが鳴く　gobble
・アヒルが鳴く　quack
・雁(がん)が鳴く　honk
・オウムなどが鳴く　screech
・フクロウが鳴く　hoot
・ハトが鳴く　coo
・カラスが鳴く　caw; croak
・ツルが鳴く　whoop
・ワシなどが鳴く　scream; shriek
・カエルが鳴く　croak

・コオロギが鳴く　chirp; chirrup
・鳴き人形　a squeaking doll
・鳴き声　⇒なきごえ２

►サヨナキドリは何と鳴きますか?　What kind of sound does a nightingale make?

・家の裏山でセミがうるさく鳴いている.　The ┏buzzing [screeching] of the cicadas in the mountains behind my house is almost deafening.
・早くも秋の虫が鳴き始めた.　The autumn insects are already ┏singing [chirping].
・この鳥は雌はめったに鳴かない.　The female of this species of bird almost never sings.
・恋し恋しと鳴くせみよりも, 鳴かぬほたるが身を焦がす.　Love in silence is more ardent than love confessed.
・鳴かぬなら殺してしまえほととぎす.　The cuckoo: if it does not sing for me, I shall have it killed.
・鳴かぬなら鳴かしてみしょうほととぎす.　The cuckoo: if it does not sing for me, I shall force it to.
・鳴かぬなら鳴くまで待とうほととぎす.　The cuckoo: if it does not sing for me, I shall wait for it to.
・今鳴いたカラスがもう笑った.　⇒からす１.

ナク [ローマ字](naku)
【化】 〔ナトリウム-カリウム合金〕 NaK; a sodium-potassium alloy.

(-)なくちゃ【(-)無くちゃ】 [ローマ字]((-)nakucha)
＝(-)なくては.

(-)なくは[も]ない【(-)無くは[も]無い】 [ローマ字]((-)nakuha[mo]nai)
not be (completely) without….
►そのつもりもなくはない.　I admit I was thinking along those lines.
・「味はどう?」「うん, まあ, おいしくなくもない」　"How does it taste?"―"Well, not bad, I suppose."
・今回の失敗は私のせいだと言えなくもない.　I suppose you could say it's my fault.

なくもがな【無くもがな】 [ローマ字](nakumogana)
►なくもがなである　can be ┏done without [dispensed with]; be better without…; be useless; be ┏superfluous [redundant, needless, unnecessary].
►その献辞にはなくもがなの美辞麗句が多かった.　The dedicatory message contained many flowery words that might better have been left out.
►そのような細かい規則はなくもがなだ.　Such ┏detailed rules are [a detailed rule is] useless [unnecessary, better left out].

ねじまげる【捩じ曲げる】 [ローマ字](nejimageru)
twist sth out of shape; contort.
►鉄棒をあめのようにねじ曲げる　twist the iron bar as if it were made of caramel
・事実をねじ曲げて伝える　twist the facts in reporting them.
►体をねじ曲げて抵抗した.　Contorting [Twisting] her body, she put up a stiff resistance.

なくなく【泣く泣く】 [ローマ字](nakunaku)
1 〔泣きながら〕 tearfully; with tears (in one's eyes); weeping; crying; between sobs.
►泣く泣く船を見送る　see off the boat with tears in one's eyes
・泣く泣く身の上を語る　tearfully relate one's story
・泣く泣くその場を立ち去る　leave [go away] weeping
・泣く泣く後事(こうじ)を頼む　beg [implore] sb in tears to look after one's affairs after one is ┏gone [dead].
2 〔いやいやながら〕 reluctantly; with reluctance; unwillingly; against one's will; with ┏a heavy [an aching] heart.
►泣く泣く退職する　retire [leave office] reluctantly [with a heavy heart]
・泣く泣く家を手放す　let one's house go [sell off one's house] with an aching heart.
►泣く泣く彼との別れを承知した.　She reluctantly agreed to part from him.
・泣く泣くその条件をのんだ.　I gave my unwilling consent to their conditions.

なくなる１【亡くなる】 [ローマ字](nakunaru)
die; pass away; breathe one's last; be dead.
►父が昨晩亡くなりました.　My father passed away yesterday evening.
・彼が亡くなって 1 年たった.　A year has passed since his death. ｜ It's been a year since he died. ｜ He has been dead for a year.
・彼女は私が生まれる 2 年前に亡くなっている.　She died two years before I was born.

なくなる２【無くなる】 [ローマ字](nakunaru)
1 〔紛失する〕 be [get] lost; be missing; be gone.
►私のハンカチがなくなった.　My handkerchief is gone. ｜ I can't find my handkerchief.
・気がついたらポケットの財布がなくなっていた.　I noticed that my wallet was missing.
2 〔消える・消失する〕 disappear 《from sight》; vanish; be gone; 〔廃止になる〕 be abolished; 〔消滅する・撲滅される〕 be eradicated; be eliminated.
►元気がなくなる　lose one's ┏vigor [energy]; grow ┏depressed [dispirited]
・自信がなくなる　lose confidence in oneself
・夢[希望]がなくなる　lose ┏one's dream [hope].
►〔手品で〕 コップの底の硬貨がなくなった.　The coin at the bottom of the glass had ┏vanished [disappeared].
・地方路線がまた 1 つなくなった.　Another local train line has been abolished.
・君に来てもらう必要はなくなった.　It is no longer necessary for you to come. ｜ Your presence is no longer needed.
・そんな心配はもうなくなった.　There is no longer need for concern on that score. ｜ There is no longer any fear of that.
・風邪が治って熱がなくなった.　My cold is better [I'm over my cold] and my fever is gone.
・この地域から交通事故がなくなった.　Traffic accidents have been eliminated in this area.
・この種の差別は決してなくならない.　This kind of discrimination will always be with us.
・その規則は現在なくなっている.　That rule no longer exists. ｜ That rule has now been abolished.
・この型のテレビは来月にはなくなります.　This television model will be discontinued by the end of next month.
・赤い公衆電話が街からなくなった.　Red public telephones are no longer seen on the streets.
・緑の公衆電話が街からなくなりかけている.　The green public telephones have started to disappear from the streets.
・ソビエトという国はなくなった.　The Soviet Union no longer exists as a country.
・世界[地上]から戦争がなくなる日が来るのだろうか?　Will the day come when we have no war ┏in the world [on earth]?
3 〔ゼロになる〕 be at [be reduced to] zero; 《口》 hit bottom; (使い果たして) be ┏exhausted [used up].
►借金がなくなる　pay off one's debts; have no debts left; get [be] out of debt
・時間がなくなる　be [run] out of time; have no time left
・貯金がなくなる　one's savings hit bottom
・資産がなくなる　exhaust one's assets.
►電車がなくなったのでタクシーで帰るしかない.　The last train has already departed, so we'll have to take a taxi back.
・これで君への借りはなくなった.　Now I've paid back everything I owe you. ｜ Now I've paid you back everything. ｜ 《口》 Now we're even.
・最終戦を引き分けたので, 決勝リーグに進む可能性はなくなった.　Since the team tied its last match, there is no possibility of them advancing to the final round of the tournament.
・両者の実力差はほとんどなくなった.　There is very little difference in their ability now.
・1 万円札はくずれたらすぐになくなってしまう.　Once you break a 10,000-yen bill, it gets used up pretty fast.
・小遣いは昼食だけでなくなってしまう.　All my spending money ┏gets used up on [goes to buy] lunch.
・ガソリンがなくなりそうだ.　I'm almost out of gas.
・飲み物がなくなったからお開きだ.　The party will be over when we run out of alcohol.
無くなす, 失くなす

なくす２【無くす】 [ローマ字](nakusu)
1 〔紛失する〕 lose sth; misplace sth; forget where one has left sth; forget where sth is; 〔失う〕 lose; be deprived of…; 〔使い果たす〕 run [be] out of….
►メモをなくす　misplace a memo
・…をなくさないようにする　make sure not to ┏lose [misplace]…
・希望をなくす　lose hope
・権力をなくす　lose [be deprived of] authority
・理性をなくす　lose control of oneself; lose the ability to think ┏clearly [《口》 straight]; 《俗》 lose one's cool
・財産をなくす　lose [be deprived of] one's fortune
・自信をなくす　lose confidence 《in oneself》.
►コートのボタンをなくした.　I've lost a button off my coat.
・財布をどこでなくしたかわからない.　I don't know where I might have left my wallet.
・何かなくしたんですか.　Did you lose something?
・なくした鍵(かぎ)が出てきた.　I found the key I (had) lost.
・その一言で私はすっかりやる気をなくした.　That comment made me lose all ┏motivation [interest].
・彼は最近すっかり元気をなくしてしまった.　He seems very depressed recently.
・例の一件で当店は信用をなくしてしまった.　The incident has caused the public to lose ┏confidence [faith] in us.
・彼女は当時の記憶をなくしている.　She has lost all memory of that period of time.
・現代英語は格変化をほとんどなくしている.　Declension is almost nonexistent in modern English.
2 〔取り去る〕 take away; remove; get rid of…; 〔廃止する〕 abolish; eliminate; do away with…; 〔撲滅する〕 eradicate; eliminate.
►死角をなくす　eliminate a blind spot
・古い法律をなくす　get rid of [abolish] outdated laws
・違いをなくす　remove [eliminate] differences
・差別[貧困]をなくす　eliminate [abolish] discrimination [poverty]
・事故をなくす　eliminate accidents.
►この弱点をなくせば優勝できる.　We can win (the tournament) as long as we can take care of this weak spot.
・富士山からごみをなくしたい.　We want Mt. Fuji to be free of trash.
・地球上から天然痘がなくなった.　Smallpox has been eradicated from the face of the earth.
・公害はどうしたらなくせるか.　How can we ┏eliminate [get rid of] pollution?
・いつまでも君のその笑顔をなくさないでね.　Never lose that smile of yours.

(-)なくて【無くて】 [ローマ字]((-)nakute)
1 〔無いために〕 for ┏want [lack] of…; in the absence of….
►なくて困るものがたくさんある.　I have many ┏needs [wants].
・仕事がなくて困る.　I need ┏work [a job] badly.
・時間がなくて困る.　I am ┏pressed [hard up] for time.
・やることがなくて参った.　I was at (my) wits' end because I didn't have anything to do.
・物的証拠がなくて無罪となった.　In the absence of material evidence, the defendant was acquitted.
・心配事もなくて晴れ晴れした気分だ.　I feel carefree and cheerful.
2 〔無しに〕 without….
►何の見返りもなくてあいつがこんな親切をするものか.　He would hardly be so thoughtful unless he expected something in return.
3 〔無くても〕 ⇒(-)なくても.
►なくて七癖.　Everyone has their own ┏peculiarities [idiosyncrasies, faults]. ｜ Every man has his faults. 【諺】

-なくて [ローマ字](-nakute)
►彼でなくて彼の妻がやってきた.　It was his wife who came, not him.
・君でなくてだれがそんなことをするものか.　Who else but you would do something like that?
・それは今日じゃなくて明日です.　That's not today but tomorrow.
・あまり甘くなくて上品な味だ.　It has a delicate taste that's not too sweet.
・小さいころは体が丈夫でなくて親を心配させたものだ.　I wasn't very healthy as a child, so my parents were always worried about me.
・なかなか話が通じなくて困った.　I had a hard time making myself understood.

(-)なくては【(-)無くては】 [ローマ字]((-)nakuteha)
►この業界は強引さがなくては生き残れない.　In this business, you can't survive unless you're aggressive.
・君でなくてはこの仕事は務まらない.　You're the only one who can handle this job.
・あなたがいなくては生きていけません.　I can't live without you.
・もう少し調べてみなくてはわからない.　I can't ┏say [tell] until I've done a little more checking.
・人生の意味を考え直させられる. 演劇とはこうでなくては(ならない).　We are made to rethink the meaning of life. This is ┏what the drama is supposed to do [how drama is supposed to be, how a play should be].
(-)無くてはいけない[ならない]
(-)なくてはいけない[ならない]

(-)なくてはいけない[ならない]【(-)無くてはいけない[ならない]】 [ローマ字]((-)nakutehaikenai[naranai])
must do; have to do; must [should, ought to] be.
►そういう結果を得るには細心の注意を払わなくてはならない.　The utmost attention is required to achieve that result.
・人間死ぬまで希望を持ち続けていなくてはならない.　People ┏need [must have] hope to go on living. ｜ We must never give up hope until our death.

ねじまがる【捩じ曲がる】 [ローマ字](nejimagaru)
get ┏twisted [warped, crooked, contorted]; twist; warp; buckle.
►コンクリートの橋脚がねじ曲がっていた.　The concrete bridge piers were twisted out of shape.

なくてはならない【無くてはならない】 [ローマ字](nakutehanaranai)
〔必要不可欠な〕 essential; necessary; indispensable; cannot be spared.
►なくてはならないもの　an essential (item); an indispensable thing 《to…》; essentials; a thing one cannot do without
・なくてはならない人物　an ┏essential [indispensable] person
・この仕事になくてはならない技術　the necessary skills for the job.
►彼女はわがチームにとってなくてはならない存在だ.　She is (absolutely) essential to the team. ｜ The team can't do without her.
・水は人間になくてはならないものだ.　Water is essential ┏to [for] human life.
・米は今でも日本人になくてはならない食料だ.　Even today, rice is an indispensable part of the Japanese diet.

(-)なくて(も)いい【(-)無くて(も)いい】 [ローマ字]((-)nakute(mo)ii)
be unnecessary; be superfluous; be not required.
►申請は本人でなくてもいい.　Anyone can apply on behalf of you. ｜ The application need not be made in person.
・部屋は清潔でさえあれば広くなくてもいい.　The room doesn't have to be big as long as it's clean.
・明日は来なくていいよ.　You ┏needn't [don't have to] come tomorrow.

(-)なくても, (-)なくとも【(-)無くても, (-)無くとも】 [ローマ字]((-)nakutemo, (-)nakutomo)
(even) ┏if [though]…not; without….
►何はなくとも　⇒なにはなくとも.
►それはなくても差しつかえはない.　I can ┏do [manage, get by] without it. ｜ It's not necessary to me.
・そんなにたくさんなくても間に合います.　We can make do without so many.
・この仕事は君でなくても務まる.　Anybody can replace you in doing this job.
・急がなくても大丈夫だよ.　We don't have to ┏hurry [rush].
・それでなくても忙しいところにまた仕事が増えた.　More jobs piled on even though I was already busy.

なま【生】 [ローマ字](nama)
1 〔加熱してない〕 raw 《fish》; uncooked; fresh 《vegetables》; 〔半煮えの〕 underdone; half-boiled; rare; 〔加工してない〕 crude 《rubber》.
►生っぽい　slightly [a bit] raw; not fully cooked
・外側は焼けていたが, 中のほうはまだ生っぽかった.　It was done on the outside, but inside it was still raw.
・腕がまだ生だ　still be ┏green [unpracticed, inexperienced]; still be a greenhorn.
►私はマリア・カラスを生で聞いたことがある.　I've heard Maria Callas sing live.
・魚を生で食べる　eat fish raw
・…を生で食べる　eat…just as they are
・(暗号でなく)生で送信する　send 《a message》 ┏uncoded [in the clear]
・生で放送する　⇒なまほうそう.
・相撲はやっぱり生で見なくちゃ (その醍醐味は味わえない).　Sumo is best when seen live.
►生の牛乳　raw [unpasteurized] milk

►何にしても[しろ]　⇒なんにしても
・何にもならない　be vain; be fruitless; be of no use; be good for nothing
・そんなことをして何になると言うの.　Just what do you think is the good of doing that?
►何の　⇒なんの
・何の考えもない人たち　unthinking people
・彼は何の役にも立たない男だ.　He is ┏no good [good for nothing].
・それは何の本ですか.　What book would that be?
・主役の君が来なくて何のパーティーだ.　What kind of party would it be if you didn't come? (You're the main attraction!)
►今のがストライクでなくて何だって言うんだ.　What do you call that if not a strike?
・自分で言うのもなんですが….　I flatter myself that….
・父親の私が言うのもなんだが, 娘はなかなか頭がいいと思う.　As a father I may be partial, but I think my daughter is quite intelligent.
・こう言ってはなんですが….　If I may be permitted to say so…. ｜ Though I shouldn't be the one to say this, ….
・なんだったら　if you have no objection
・なんでしたら私が聞いてみましょうか.　If you don't mind, shall I ask for you?
・いま何て言ったの?　What did you say?
・彼は貧乏の何たるかを知っている.　He is fully aware what it is like to be poor. ｜ He knows all that poverty can tell.
・何でもありません.　〔大丈夫かと聞かれて〕 I'm all right. ｜ 〔何かあったのかと聞かれて〕 Nothing (ᐦhas) happened. ｜ Nothing's the matter. [⇒なんでもない]

なんだ【何だ】 [ローマ字](nanda)
1 〔何であるか〕 what?; 〔(反語的に)何でもない〕 ⇒なに１ 1, なん１.
►なんだか　⇒なんだか
・何だって　⇒なんだって
・なんだの　⇒なんだの.
►「ねえ」「何だい?」　"Dear..."―"Yeah, what do you want?"
・なんだ?　〔言いよどんでいる人に促す〕 What is it? ｜ Go ahead.
・何だどうした.　What's wrong? ｜ What's the matter? ｜ What happened? ｜ 《口》 What's up?
・何だ何だこの騒ぎは.　What's all this commotion?
・これは一体何だ.　What in the world is this? ｜ 《口》 What the hell is this?
・何だその態度は!　I don't like your attitude!
・馬鹿とは何だ. もう一度言ってみろ!　How dare you call me a fool! Just try saying that again.
・「こないだの件やっといてくれた?」「何だったっけ」　"Did you finish up that thing I asked you to do the other day?"―"Now what was that?"
・このぐらいの傷が何だ.　A wound like this is nothing.
・「そんなことすると先生に怒られるよ」「先生が何だ!」　"If you do that, the teacher will get angry."―"I don't care what the teacher thinks [《口》 To hell with the teacher]."
・金が何だ. 大切なのは心だよ.　Who cares about money? It's what's in your heart that's important.
・女にふられたぐらいで何だ.　So what if a woman dumps you?
・何だと!　What? ｜ What do you mean? ｜ What did you say? ｜ Would you mind repeating that?
2 〔間投詞的用法〕 what!; why!
►なんだ君か. おどかすなよ.　Oh, it's you. Don't scare me like that!
・なんだ, そういうことだったのか.　So that's it. ｜ Well, that explains it.
・なんだ, それならそうと早く言えばいいのに.　Well, you should have said so before.
・なんだ, もうおしまい? あっけないなあ.　What, is it over already? That was too short.
・まあ, なんだ, 僕もさっきはちょっと言いすぎたよ.　Well, I may have gone too far in what I just said.
・つまり, なんだ, この件はこれでおしまいということだな.　So that's the end of the matter, then.

なんだが, なんだけど, なんですが【何だが, 何だけど, 何ですが】 [ローマ字](nandaga, nandakedo, nandesuga)
►こう言っては何だけど….　Excuse me for my frankness, but…. ｜ To be frank with you [To speak frankly], …. ｜ It may be ┏rude [unkind] to say so, but….
・こう言っては何だけど, 今回の失敗は君の責任が大きいと思うよ.　I hate to say this, but you bear a large part of the responsibility for this failure.
・こう言っては何だが, 彼はこの仕事に向いてないんじゃないかな.　I hesitate to say anything, but I'm wondering if he may not be suitable for this job.
・自分で言うのも何だけど…　If I may be permitted to say so, …. ｜ I shouldn't be saying this myself, but….
・自分で言うのも何ですが, うちの子はとてもいい子でしてね.　My son is a very good boy, ┏even if I do say so myself [《文》 though I may say so myself].
・こういうと何だが, あの夫婦はもうおしまいだね.　If I may say so, that marriage is already over.

・難題に取り組む　deal with a difficult problem.
►政府は今, 輸入自由化と雇用確保の両立という難題を突きつけられている.　The government is currently confronted with the difficult problem of both liberalizing trade and maintaining employment.
・難題を解決する　solve a difficult problem.
2 〔無理な要求〕 an ┏unreasonable [impossible] demand.
►難題を吹っかける[押しつける]　make an ┏unreasonable [impossible] demand upon sb; demand [ask] too much of sb
・彼は次々と難題を吹っかけてきた.　He came at me with one unreasonable demand after another.
◨無理難題　⇒むりなんだい.

・「リンカーンは何代目のアメリカ大統領ですか」「16 代目です」　"How many presidents were there before Lincoln?"―"Fifteen." ｜ "Where ┏is Lincoln [does Lincoln come] in the ┏list [order] of American presidents?"―"He's the sixteenth."

なんだか【何だか】 [ローマ字](nandaka)
1 〔何であるか〕 what it is.
►あの山の上の白い物が何だかわかりますか.　Do you know what that white stuff on top of the mountain is?
・何が何だかさっぱりわからない.　We don't know what's what.
2 〔少々〕 somewhat; a little; 《口》 kind [sort] of; 〔なぜかわからないが〕 somehow (or other); for some reason (or other). [⇒なんとなく, なんか５ 2]
►なんだか気にかかる.　Somehow I feel uneasy (about it). ｜ It bothers me somehow.
・なんだかきまりが悪い.　I feel ┏kind [sort] of ┏embarrassed [self-conscious].
・なんだか疲れた.　I feel tired for some reason.
・あなた今日はなんだか変よ.　What's the matter with you today? ｜ You're acting kind of strange(ly) today.
・なんだかそんな気がしました.　Something told me so.
・なんだかあやしい雲行きだね.　The clouds look threatening, don't they?
・なんだかむしょうに君に会いたくなった.　For some reason I was desperate to see you.
・君とこんな所で話してるなんてなんだか不思議な気持ちだ.　It feels strange somehow to be talking to you in a place like this.

なんだかんだ【何だかんだ】 [ローマ字](nandakanda)
one thing or another; this or that; this and that and the other.
►何だかんだで金がいる.　I need money for this and that.
►何だかんだと忙しい.　I am busy with one thing and another.
・何だかんだ(と)言って　〔偽りの口実で〕 on ┏one [some] pretext or another; 〔いろいろな理由で〕 for ┏one [some] reason or another
・何だかんだ(と)言っている間にもう着いてしまった.　As we were talking about this and that, we found ourselves arriving at our destination.
・彼は何だかんだ(と)言い訳ばかりしていて一向に着手してくれない.　He's always making excuses and never gets around to working.
・このところ何だかんだ(と)物入りが続いて懐が苦しい.　With all these expenses, I'm strapped for cash these days.
・何だかんだ言っても彼女は夫を愛してるんだよ.　Whatever [In spite of everything, Regardless of what] she says, she loves her husband.

►「彼, 何だって?」「うん, すぐ来るって」　"What did he say?"―"Uh, he said he's coming soon."
・「すみません, 忘れました」「何だって?」　"I'm sorry. I forgot."―"What do you mean, you forgot?"

なんで【何で】 [ローマ字](nande)

なんでも【何でも】 [ローマ字](nandemo)
1 〔どんな物[事]でも〕 any; whatever; whatever [anything] one likes; (何でもひとつ) anything; (どれもこれも) everything; (すべて) all.
►何でもひととおりできる人　an all-rounder; an all-round[*-around] person; a Jack-of-all-trades
・なんでもいいから　⇒なんでもいいから
・なんでもか(ん)でも　⇒なんでもか(ん)でも.
►何でも好きなものを選びなさい.　Choose anything you like.
・彼はスポーツなら何でもござれだ.　Sports come easily to him.
・彼はアルコール類であれば何でもいい.　He'll drink anything that's got alcohol in it.
・私にできることなら何でもしますから言ってください.　I'll do anything I can for you if you just ask.
・欲しいものは何でもやるぞ.　I'll give you whatever you want.
・ここへ来れば何でもそろう.　This store has everything you might need.
・それで妻が治るのなら何でもやる.　I'd ┏do anything to [try anything if (I thought) it would] cure my wife's illness.
・わからないことがあったら何でも聞いてください.　If there's anything you don't understand, just ask.
・「お飲み物は何にしましょう?」「冷たいものなら何でもけっこう」　"What ┏would you like [will you have] to drink?"―"Anything cold ┏would be [will do] fine."
・彼はかっとすると何でもやりかねない.　There's no telling what he'll do if he loses his temper.
・私は好き嫌いなく何でも食べます.　I'm not fussy―I eat anything.
2 〔聞くところでは〕 I ┏hear [understand]; I am told; they say.
►なんでも米国に帰化するつもりだそうだ.　I ┏hear [understand] that he intends to become an American citizen.
・なんでもあの二人はとっくに別れているらしい.　If my information is right, those two have been separated for a long time.
・彼はなんでも近く辞任するという話だ.　I don't know for certain, but they say he is going to resign.
・このあたりはなんでも昔刑場だったって聞きました.　From what I'm told, this area was an execution ground in the old days.

なんでもあり【何でもあり】 [ローマ字](nandemoari)
no holds barred; no limits.
►この国の選挙は誹謗中傷贈収賄何でもありだ.　The elections in this country are rife with slander, libel, and bribery, whatever it takes to win.
・このスポーツは観客を喜ばせるためなら何でもありだ.　In this sport, they do whatever they have to in order to please the spectators.

なんでもいいから【何でもいいから】 [ローマ字](nandemoiikara)
〔何でもかまわないから〕 anything at all; I don't care what; 〔とにもかくにも〕 anyhow; at all events; at any rate.
►何でもいいから食べる物をくれ.　Give me something to eat―I don't care what.
・何でもいいから何か一つ夢中になれるものを見つけたい.　I want to find something that I can really get excited about, no matter what it is.
・「何なんですか」「何でもいいから一緒に来るんだ」　"What's going on?"―"Never mind [Don't ask questions], just come with me. ｜ You just come with me, that's all."
・何でもいいから黙っててくれないか.　Never mind, just be quiet!
・「やっぱりこっちの靴のほうがいいかしら」「何でもいいから早くして」　"Now that I think about it, I wonder if these shoes might be better."―"I don't care one way or the other―just hurry up."

なんでもか(ん)でも【何でもか(ん)でも】 [ローマ字](nandemoka(n)demo)
〔どんなものでも〕 (anything and) everything; all sorts of things; 〔是が非でも〕 by all means; at any cost. [＝なにがなんでも]
►何でもかんでも手当たり次第に投げつける　throw anything one can get one's hands on
・何でもかんでも欲しがる　want everything one sees.
►彼は何でもかんでも人のせいにする.　He blames other people for everything.
・何でもかんでも多数決にすればよいというものではない.　Not everything can be determined by a majority decision.
・この会社は何でもかんでも上部にうかがいを立てないと決められないようになっている.　In this company nothing at all can be decided without first seeing how top management stands on it.
・この子の命は何でもかんでも救ってみせる.　I will do anything it takes to save this child's life.
拮抗的二重支配　【生理】 〔自律神経の〕 antagonistic double innervation.

なんでもない【何でもない】 [ローマ字](nandemonai)
〔たやすい〕 easy; 〔重要でない〕 trivial; minor; of no ┏account [consequence]; 〔無害な〕 harmless; innocent. [⇒なんともない]
►何でもないこと　〔やさしいこと〕 an easy ┏thing [task]; 〔ちょっとしたこと〕 a ┏minor [trifling] matter; a (mere) trifle; nothing serious
・何でもないことでいちいち騒ぐな.　Don't make a fuss about every little thing.
・日常の何でもないことを彼女はいとも簡単に一編の詩にしてしまう.　She finds it easy to turn a trivial daily occurrence into a poem.
・あなたの技術を見たときは何でもないことのように思えたが, 実際やってみたら至難の業だった.　When I saw your skill, it looked like nothing, but when I actually tried to do it myself, it was extremely difficult.
►彼の何でもないしぐさの一つ一つにファンは熱狂した.　His fans went wild at his most unassuming gesture.
・「どうかしたの」「何でもないよ」　"Is something wrong?"―"It's nothing serious." ｜ "What's the matter?"―"Nothing's the matter."
・あんなやつを負かすのは何でもない.　I can beat him hands down.
・このくらいの雨は何でもない.　This amount of rain is nothing to get upset about.
・それくらいの値段なら何でもない.　At that price there's no problem at all.
・彼にとっては 100 万円くらいは何でもない.　One million yen is nothing to him.
・二日二晩寝ないぐらい彼には何でもなかった.　It was nothing for him to go without sleep for two days and two nights.
・母の病気は何でもありませんでした.　My mother's illness was nothing serious.
・そんなことは何でもない.　〔容易である〕 That is easy to do. ｜ That is easily done. ｜ 〔大したことではない〕 It is of no consequence. ｜ It's nothing to me. ｜ It doesn't matter to me.
・これくらいのことは私には何でもない.　A little thing like this is nothing to me.
…でもなんでもない　〔全然違う〕 be no…; be no kind of….
►彼は学者でもなんでもない.　He is no scholar.
・彼は親類[友達]でもなんでもない.　He is no ┏relative [friend] of mine at all.
・親たちの苦労に比べればこのぐらい苦労でもなんでもない.　Compared to what my parents went through, you can't really call this suffering at all.

なんど１【何度】 [ローマ字](nando)
1 〔度盛りの〕 how many degrees.
►この残雪は気温何度で解け始めますか.　At what temperature will this remaining snow start to melt?
►昨日の最高気温は何度でしたか.　What was the high (temperature) yesterday?
・水の沸点はカ氏で何度ですか.　At how many degrees Fahrenheit does water boil? ｜ What is the boiling point of water in Fahrenheit?
・昨夜あの患者の熱は何度ありましたか.　What was that patient's temperature last night?
・あの坂の傾斜は何度ぐらいでしょうね.　How many degrees do you think the slope of that hill is?
2 〔回数〕 how many times; how often. [⇒なんべん１, いくど, なんかい１]
►お望みなら何度でもお見せしますよ.　I shall show it to you as many times as you wish.
・これは洗うだけで何度でも繰り返して使えるので便利です.　All you have to do is wash this, and you can use it any number of times, so it's convenient.
►気をつけろってあれほど何度も言ったのに.　But I told you any number of times to be careful.
・この映画は若いころ何度も繰り返して見ました.　I saw this film any number of times when I was young.
・彼が笑顔を見せることは年に何度もない.　He smiles perhaps once a year.
・こういことはこれまでに何度もあった.　This kind of thing has happened many times in the past.
►去年は何度スキーに行きましたか.　How many times did you go skiing last year?
・月に何度ぐらい夫婦で買い物に出かけますか.　How many times per month do the two of you go shopping together?
・そうしろって何度話したかわからない.　I must have told you a hundred times to do that.
・何度電話をかけても通じなかった.　I called her a number of times but cannot get her (on the phone).
・何度聞いても答えはノーだった.　No matter how many times I asked, the answer was "no."
・何度となく注意したにもかかわらず, またもや彼は遅刻した.　Despite my warning him time after time, he turned up late again.
・運転には気をつけろと何度言ったらわかるんだ.　How many times do I have to tell you to take care when driving?
◧何度目
►来日はこれで何度目ですか.　How many times have you come to Japan, including this time?
・何度目かの失敗でようやくあきらめた.　After failing ┏any number of times [《口》 for the umpteenth time], he eventually gave up.

・何がわからないって女心くらいわからないものはない.　The hardest thing in the world to understand is a woman's mind.

・君は何が不満でいつもそんな仏頂面をしているんだ.　What do you have to complain about that you're always pulling that long face?

・大きくなったら何になりたい?　What do you want to be when you grow up?

►朝はいつも何を飲みますか.　What do you drink at breakfast?

・「お母さんは何をしていますか」「主婦です」　"What does your mother do?"―"She's a housewife."
