・あの国の税関はなにがしか包んでやればすんなり通れるといううわさだ.　It's said that in that country, if you cross the custom inspector's palm with a little cash, you can waltz right through.

なにげない【何気ない】 [ローマ字](nanigenai)
〔さりげない〕 casual; 〔特に気にかけない〕 unconcerned.
►何気ないそぶりで　in a casual manner; with an air of unconcern
・何気ないふうをする　〔気にかけないふりをする〕 pretend ┏unconcern [nonchalance]; 〔気づかないふりをする〕 look innocent; feign ignorance
・彼は何気ないふうをしてそれを手に取った.　He took it up in his hand casually, as though he hadn't the least concern.
►彼は何気ないようすで席についた.　He sat down as if ┏nothing had happened [he hadn't a care in the world].
・何気ない一言が相手を深く傷つけることもある.　A casual word may cause the listener the deepest hurt.

なにげなく【何気なく】 [ローマ字](nanigenaku)
〔意図せず〕 unintentionally; without intending to do so; 〔ふと〕 casually; accidentally; by accident; 〔不注意に〕 carelessly; inadvertently; unguardedly; 〔さりげなく〕 as if nothing had happened; unconcernedly; 〔何も気づかず〕 innocently.
►何気なく言ったこと　a remark dropped ┏casually [inadvertently]; a chance remark
・何気なくしたこと　an inadvertent action
・何気なく時計を見る　glance casually at one's watch.
►普段何気なくしていることも, 文化を異にする人から見ると新鮮に映るらしい.　In the eyes of someone from another culture, even the most casual everyday actions take on a certain freshness.
・あの時は渡されるままに何気なく受け取ってしまったが, この金は私がもらうべきではなかった.　I accepted it without a second thought when it was handed to me then, but this is money I never should have taken.
・何気なく入ったのだが, 意外に感じのいい店だった.　I just wandered in casually but it turned out to be a very charming shop.
・何気なく目を上げると見知らぬ男がじっと私を見ていた.　When I ┏chanced [happened] to look up, there was a strange man staring at me fixedly.
・だれかが何気なく言った一言がいつまでも心に残ることがある.　Sometimes an ┏unthinking [off-the-cuff, off-hand] remark from someone can stay with you for a long time.

なにごと【何事】 [ローマ字](nanigoto)
what; whatever; 〔大事〕 an important [a weighty] matter; a crisis.
►何事もなく　quietly; peacefully; smoothly; uneventfully; without ┏mishap [incident, a hitch]
・その晩は何事もなく過ぎた.　The night passed without incident.
・何事もなかったかのように　as if nothing had happened
・何事も辞さない　stick [stop] at nothing 《to do》.
►ああびっくりした. 一体何事が起こったかと思ったよ.　You gave me quite a shock. I thought that something dreadful had happened.
►何事にも[によらず]　in everything; in all ┏matters [things]
・彼は何事にも腹を立てない.　Nothing can ┏ruffle [get a rise out of] him.
・彼は何事によらず妻に聞いてから決める.　He consults his wife in everything before making up his mind.
►何事ですか.　What's up now? ｜ What's the matter?
・この騒ぎは何事だ.　What's this commotion all about?
・何事かと思って飛び出してみた.　I ran out to see what the matter was.
・このざまは何事だ.　Just what's the meaning of this (appalling behavior)?
・親に口答えするとは何事だ.　That you should talk back to your father!
・何事も後見人とよく相談して決めなさい.　Be sure to discuss everything with your guardian before coming to any decisions.
・人間何事も忍耐だよ.　What you need in everything is perseverance.

なにはなくとも【何は無くとも】 [ローマ字](nanihanakutomo)
〔何よりもまず〕 above all else; more than anything else; 〔他のものはなくともよいが〕 (even) if nothing else.
►さてと, 何は無くとも酒だ.　Of course we can't do without sake. ｜ Sake alone I cannot do without.
・海外旅行に行くには何は無くともパスポートが必要だ.　To travel overseas the one thing you can't do without is a passport.
・何は無くとも家族が一番.　Family is the most important thing, no matter what.

なにはさておき【何はさて措き】 [ローマ字](nanihasateoki)
above all; first of all; first and foremost; before doing anything else; in the first place; before ┏anything [everything] else.
►何はさて措き負傷者の救出だ.　First of all we have to rescue the injured.
・何はさて措き明日の朝一番にそれをやらなければいけない.　I have to do it first thing tomorrow morning.

なにはともあれ【何はともあれ】 [ローマ字](nanihatomoare)
in any case; at all events; at any rate; at least; if nothing else. [⇒とにかく]
►何はともあれご無事で何よりだった.　At any rate [What's most important is (that)] you're safe (and sound).
・何はともあれ君にだけは知らせておこうと思って.　I thought (that, if no one else,) I should at least tell you.
・何はともあれ思いやりの心だけは忘れない子に育てたつもりだ.　I have hoped, ┏at least [at the (very) least, if nothing else], to have fostered in her a sense of fellow feeling.

なにひとつ【何一つ】 [ローマ字](nanihitotsu)
►何一つ文句を言わず働く　work without (making) a single complaint
・何一つ持たずに家出する　run away from home taking nothing with one.
►彼女を有罪とする証拠は何一つない.　There isn't a ┏single piece [shred] of evidence to convict her.
・彼の供述に疑わしい点は何一つなかった.　There wasn't a single suspect item in his testimony.
・彼は妻に相談せずには何一つ決断できない亭主だ.　He's the sort of husband who can't decide a single thing without consulting his wife.
・やましいことは何一つしていない.　I've done nothing at all that I (need) feel guilty about.

なにほど【何程】 [ローマ字](nanihodo)
1 〔どのくらい〕 ＝いかほど.
►何ほどの道のりでもない.　It's not far at all. ｜ It's not very far from here.
・何ほどのこともない.　〔大したことはない〕 It's a very small matter. ｜ It's a matter of slight significance.
・偉そうなことを言っているが何ほどのこともあるまい.　He talks big, but I don't think he will count for much.
2 〔どんなに〕 ⇒いかに 2.

なにか【何か】 [ローマ字](nanika)
1 some; any; something; anything.
►…か何か　…or something (of the ┏sort [kind])
・菓子か何か　cake or something of the ┏sort [kind]
・お茶か何か飲みませんか.　Would you care for some tea or something?
・彼, 俳句か何か始めたらしいよ.　It appears he's taken up haiku or something of the sort.
・「あの人だれ?」「早田の親類か何かだろう」　"Who is he?"―"He must be some relation of Hayata's."
・「あの人何してる人?」「弁護士か何からしいよ」　"What does he do?"―"Apparently, he's a lawyer or something of the sort."
・弁当は自分で作るか何かして持ってきてください.　Put together your own lunchbox or something, and bring it with you.
・「どうしたの, そのアザ」「さあ, ぶつけるか何かしたんだろう」　"Where did you get that bruise?"―"I don't know, I must have bumped it or something."
・あいつのことだ, どうせまた二日酔いか何かだろう.　Knowing him, you can bet he's got a hangover or something.
►何かうまいもの　something nice to eat
・何か冷たいもの　something cold to drink
・何か飲むもの[食べるもの]　something to ┏drink [eat]
・何か変なものでも食べたんじゃない?　Are you sure ┏it wasn't something you ate [you didn't eat something funny]?
・何か書くものはありませんか.　Do you have something to write with?
・何か聞きたいことはないですか.　Is there anything you'd like to ask?
・何か面白いことないかなあ.　Isn't there anything fun to do?
・何か体にいいことしてますか.　Are you doing anything to stay fit?
・私何か悪いこと言いました?　Did I say ┏something to offend you [anything wrong]?
・何かお手伝いすることないですか.　Is there anything I can do to help?
・何か忘れてることがあるような気がするんだが思い出せない.　I know there's something I've forgotten, but I can't think what it was.
・今に何かよくないことが起こるんじゃないだろうか.　I can't help feeling that something bad is about to happen.
・何かわけがあって　for some reason (or other)
・何かある　〔問題が起こる〕 have a ┏problem [situation] arise
・何かあったらここに電話しなさい.　If anything happens, call this number.
・彼が遅れるなんて何かあったに違いない.　It's not like him to be late―something must have happened.
・何かあったんじゃないかと心配したよ.　I thought something must have happened (to you).
・何かあってからでは遅い. 十分注意するように.　Let's not wait until you have an accident. You just be very careful.
・あの二人には何かあるんじゃないかと にらんでるんだ.　I have a hunch there's something going on with those two.
・何かぶつぶつ言いながら　muttering something
・何かと言うと　⇒なにかというと
・何かかにか　⇒なにかかにか
・何かと　⇒なにかと.
►何かがある　＝〜ある
・闇の中で何かが動いた.　Something or other moved in the darkness.
・教育の現場で今何かが狂い始めている気がしてならない.　I can't ┏help feeling [shake off the feeling] that something is going seriously amiss in the classroom at the present time.
►彼は電車の事故か何かで遅れるらしい.　I hear he's being delayed by a train accident or something.
・何かで読んだんだが, 植物は人間の感情に反応するんだってね.　I read somewhere that plants respond to human emotion.
►たしか雑誌か何かに出ていたんだが.　I'm sure I saw it in a magazine or somewhere.
・大事なことは何かに書いておかないと.　When you've got something important to do, you should write it down on something.
・車は何かにぶつかって止まった.　The car hit against something and stopped.
・何かにつけて　⇒なにかにつけ(て).
►何かの原因で　from one cause or another
・何かの都合で　owing to some circumstances
・何かのはずみで　due to an unexpected turn of events
・あの男は何かのきっかけで暴れだすと手に負えない.　Once something sets him off, there's nothing you can do to control him.
・これも何かの縁でしょう.　I guess it must have been some kind of fate.
►何か焦げてない?　Is there something burning?
・肩に何かついてますよ.　You've got something on your shoulder.
・どこかで何か食べていこうよ.　Let's stop off somewhere and grab something to eat.
・何かご用ですか.　Is there something you want? ｜ Can I do something for you?
・何かお役に立てばうれしいのですが.　If I can be of any ┏service [help] to you, I shall be glad.
2 〔なんとなく〕 ⇒なんとなく, なぜか, どことなく.
3 〔相手の意向を確認する〕
►それじゃ何か, これは私のせいだというのかね?　So what you're trying to say is, this is my fault, is that it?
・返済期限は今日だよ. それとも何か, 明日まで待てば倍にして返せるとでも言うのか?　The repayment deadline is today. Or do I hear you say you're going to pay double if I wait until tomorrow?
何かが道をやってくる

「何かが道をやってくる」 [ローマ字](nanikagamichioyattekuru)

なにかかにか【何か彼にか】 [ローマ字](nanikakanika)
this or that; something or other; one thing or another.
►彼はいつも何かかにかしている.　He's always ┏doing [up to] one thing or another.
►彼はいつも何かかにか文句を言っている.　He is always complaining about ┏something or other [this and that].
・お前はいつも何かかにかいたずらをしているね.　You are always up to some mischief or other.

・母は何かかにか仕事を見つけては一日じゅう働いている.　Mother manages to find one chore after another to keep her busy all day long.

なにかにつけ(て)【何彼につけ(て)】 [ローマ字](nanikanitsuke(te))
one way or another; somehow or other; in various ways; in everything; whenever opportunity offers.
►何かにつけ(て)お忙しいでしょう.　You must be busy what with one thing and another.
・何かにつけ(て)お世話になります.　I will depend on your ┏kindness [good offices] in everything.
・何かにつけ(て)彼のことが思い出されてならない.　Everything seems to remind me of him.
・それはあると何かにつけ(て)重宝する.　It's invaluable for all sorts of things.
・彼は何かにつけ(て)アメリカの大学ではそうじゃないと言う.　He ┏takes [finds] every occasion to say that things aren't (done) this way in American universities.

＝らち２.

なにからなにまで【何から何まで】 [ローマ字](nanikarananimade)
(anything and) everything; every ┏imaginable [conceivable] thing; down to the last detail; from one end of the spectrum to the other. [⇒なにもかも]
►何から何まで人に頼りきった生活　a lifestyle of depending on others for every little thing
・何から何まで親に面倒を見てもらう　have one's parents look after one in everything
・何から何まで紫ずくめの服装　《be dressed in》 an outfit purple to the last stitch.
►何から何までお見通しなんだね.　You've seen through all of it down to the last detail, haven't you?
・何から何までよく気のつく人だ.　There is nothing that escapes his attention.
・その仕事はこの私が何から何まで心得ている.　I happen to know the business inside out. ▶I に強勢を置く.
・コンビニには日常必要な物は何から何までそろっている.　The convenience store carries every conceivable daily necessity.
・彼の話は何から何までうそっぱちだ.　His story is a lie right down to the roots.
・彼はパソコンのことなら何から何まで知っている.　When it comes to PCs he knows everything ┏about them, from A to Z [there is to know about them].
・私だって何から何まで知っているわけではない.　It's not as though I'm familiar with every detail.
・見てみろよ, 何から何までキンキラキンだぜ.　Look at all the gold on her!

なにかしら【何か知ら】 [ローマ字](nanikashira)
〔あれこれ〕 something or other; 〔何となく〕 somehow or other; I don't know why, but…; 〔原因不明〕 for some (unknown) reason.
►何かしら胸騒ぎがする　feel an uneasiness without knowing why
・何かしら不安を感じる　feel some nameless anxiety.
►この公園にはいつも何かしら花が咲いている.　There are always some flowers or other blooming in this park.
・彼は最近何かしら口実を見つけては彼女に電話をかけてくる.　Nowadays he's always finding some pretext or other to go call her up.
・祖母は来れば何かしら必ずお土産を持ってきてくれた.　Whenever my grandmother came visiting she inevitably brought one sort of gift or another.

なにかと【何彼と】 [ローマ字](nanikato)
in ┏various [many, lots of] ways; in more ways than one; (in) one way or another.
►暮れは何かと忙しい.　At year's end, I'm quite busy with one thing or another.
・何かと心配事が絶えない.　One always has worries of one sort or another.
・彼は村の人々から何かと頼りにされている.　The villagers depend on him in all sorts of ways.
・その節は何かとお世話になりました.　Thank you for all your many kindnesses back then.
・これがあると何かと便利だ.　It comes in handy in all sorts of ways.

なにかというと【何かと言うと】 [ローマ字](nanikatoiuto)
on the least pretext; at the drop of a hat.
►祖父は何かと言うと昔はよかったと言う.　Grandfather will always find a pretext to tell you how much better things were in the old days.
・あの男は何かと言うと暴力に訴えるので困る.　The trouble with him is that he always tries to settle everything by physical force.
・君は何かと言うと子供の自慢をするが, ちょっと見苦しいよ.　The way you're always finding occasion to brag about your kid is sometimes hard to take.

なにくれと(なく)【何くれと(なく)】 [ローマ字](nanikureto(naku))
＝なにかと.
►両親の死後, 兄は何くれと(なく)私の面倒を見てくれた.　After our parents died, my brother looked after me in every way.

なにくそ【何糞】 [ローマ字](nanikuso)
I'll be (god)damned [Damn me] 《if I ┏give in [lose, quit]》.
►何くそきさまなどに負けるものか.　I'll be goddamned if I lose to the likes of you.
・何くそという気持ちがわれわれに厳しい練習を耐えさせた.　What got us through that tough training was an attitude that said: "Hell no, we won't quit for anything."
・倒産以来, 何くそという気持ちで今日まで頑張ってきた.　After the bankruptcy I just said, "Damn me if I knuckle under to this," and I rolled up my sleeves and got back to where I am today.

なにくわぬかお【何食わぬ顔】 [ローマ字](nanikuwanukao)
an ┏innocent [unconcerned] look [air].
►何食わぬ顔で　〔平然と〕 with ┏a nonchalant [an unconcerned] look; with an air of (perfect) nonchalance; unconcernedly; 〔知らぬ顔をして〕 with an air of innocence; affecting ┏innocence [ignorance]; pretending not to know; as if nothing had happened
・犯人は何食わぬ顔で犯行現場に戻った.　The perpetrator returned to the scene with an air of perfect innocence.
・その事件の犯人は何食わぬ顔で行方不明の被害者の捜索に協力していた.　The one who committed the crime then, with an air of perfect equanimity, cooperated in the search for the missing victim.
・うそがばれているのは感じたが, 私は何食わぬ顔で話を続けた.　I sensed that my lie had been pierced, but I persisted with an innocent air.
・その翌朝会社に出てくると, 彼女は何食わぬ顔でおはようと言った.　The next morning she walked into the office and said "Good morning" as though nothing had happened.
►何食わぬ顔をする　wear [put on] an ┏innocent [unconcerned] look [air, face]; feign ┏innocence [ignorance]; assume a nonchalant air
・彼は何食わぬ顔をして横を向いた.　He put on a face of perfect innocence and looked aside.

なにも【何も】 [ローマ字](nanimo)
1 〔まったく〕
►何も…ない　〔まったく…ない〕 one has nothing (at all) ｜ there is nothing (at all)
・何もすることがない　have ┏nothing [no work] to do
・何も取らないで逃げる　run ┏off [away] empty-handed; flee without taking a thing
・何もしないで遊んで暮らしている　do (absolutely) nothing all day but ┏amuse oneself [have fun]; do not do anything in life but look for a good time; live an idle life; eat the bread of idleness.
►食べる物が何もない.　We haven't (got) a single thing to eat.
・コンピューターについては何も知らない.　I don't know ┏the first [《俗》 a damn] thing about computers.
・彼は何も知らずに笑っていた.　Knowing nothing [Completely ignorant] of the situation, he was all smiles.
・「そっちはどうだ?」「今のところ何も変わったことはない」　"And you?"―"Oh, at the moment nothing new."
・食糧は何も残っていない.　There is no food left.
・水も食糧も何もない.　There's not a scrap of food, nor a drop of water.
・私はもう何も言うことはない.　I have nothing more to say (to you). ｜ I have said all I have to say (to you).
・何もございませんが上がってお食事でも.　We don't have anything special to offer, but come on in and eat with us.
・何もしていないのにいきなり殴られた.　I wasn't doing anything and all of a sudden I got punched.
・ただ見ているだけで何もできなかった自分が悔しい.　It makes me feel terrible that I just stood by watching and couldn't do a thing.
・何もお役に立てなくてすみません.　I'm sorry I wasn't any help to you.
2 〔何もかも; それどころか〕
►…も何も　…and ┏all [everything]
・先日の浸水で家具も何も全部だめになった.　The flood waters the other day ruined the furniture and everything else.
・信号も何も無視して突っ走った.　He drove full speed, ignoring the traffic lights and everything.
・知っているも何も, そんな男には会ったことさえない.　Know him? I haven't even ever met him.
・「痛かったでしょうねえ」「痛いも何も息が止まりましたよ」　"It must have hurt."―"Hurt? It made me stop breathing!"
3 〔そこまで; 取り立てて〕
►何も泣くことはないじゃないか.　Come now. There's [You've] no reason to cry.
・何もそう怒らなくたっていいだろうが.　You have no reason whatever to be so angry. ｜ There's no reason to be so angry, is there? ｜ Why in the world do you have to get so riled?
・何もそこまでしてやるには及ぶまい.　There's no reason to put yourself out like that for them. ｜ There's no need to do so much for them.
・何もそう急がなくても, お茶ぐらい飲んでいきなさいよ.　Don't rush off. (At least) stay for tea.
・まあまあ, 何もそう興奮しなくても.　Come now! Don't get so excited.
・確かに私も悪かったけど, 何もそんな言い方をすることはないでしょう.　Okay, I was wrong, too. Still, I don't think I deserve to be spoken to like that.
・何も君を責めているわけじゃないんだ.　I haven't the least intention of criticizing you.
・何もおごらせようとは言ってませんよ. 一杯やりたいですねと言っただけで.　Hey, I'm not asking you to buy me one. All I said was (that) I wish I could have a drink.
・労働と言っても何も肉体労働とは限らない.　The word labor does not necessarily mean physical labor.
・重症といったって何も助からないと決まったわけじゃない.　So what if she's in a serious condition, it doesn't ┏necessarily mean [mean in the least] that she won't get better. ｜ Even if she's in a critical condition, it doesn't necessarily mean she's ┏bound [doomed] to die.

なにもかも【何も彼も】 [ローマ字](nanimokamo)
everything; the whole lot; every ┏single [little] thing; anything and everything; 《口》 everything but the kitchen sink; the whole (kit and) caboodle.
►何もかも承知している　know ┏everything [all] 《about…》; know ┏everything that [what] is ┏happening [going on]; 《口》 know what one is about; know what's what; be on top of the situation
・何もかも承知のうえで　fully understanding the situation; knowing everything 《about…》; 《口》 being on top of the situation; knowing what one is about
・何もかも話す　tell sb the whole story; tell sb every detail 《of…》; give sb the full particulars 《about…》; tell sb everything that happened
・何もかも白状する　make a clean breast of 《an affair》; own up; tell everything one knows; make a full confession; tell all.

なんの【何の】 [ローマ字](nanno)

・それは何の本?　What is that book about?

・「こないだ貸した金だけど」「何の話?」　"It's about the money I lent you recently."―"I don't know what you're talking about."
・何の因果でこんな目にあうのやら.　I do not know what I have done to deserve such misery.
・「今日が何の日か覚えてる?」「あっ, 誕生日おめでとう!」　"Do you remember what day it is today?"―"Oh, Happy Birthday!"
・これは一体何のつもりかね?　What do you think you're doing? ｜ What's the idea of doing this?

►何の問題もなく　without a ┏hitch [accident]

なんとも【何とも】 [ローマ字](nantomo)
1 〔まったく〕 quite; 〔本当に〕 really.
►なんとも言えない美しさ　indescribable beauty

►なんとも困ったことになった.　It's quite upsetting. ｜I'm in an awful mess.
・なんとも愉快でたまらない.　I'm so delighted that I don't know what to do with myself.

・競技場はなんとも異様な熱気に包まれていた.　The stadium was enveloped in a most extraordinary atmosphere of excitement.

・彼はなんとも言わず出かけて行った.　He went out without a single word.
・彼からはまだなんとも便りがない.　I haven't heard a thing from him yet.

・痛くもなんともない.　I feel no pain at all.

なお【尚・猶】 [ローマ字](nao)
1 〔まだ〕 still (not); (not) yet; 〔相変わらず〕 still; 〔引き続き〕 still.
►今もなお　still
・昼なお暗い森の奥で　deep in the woods where it is dark even during the day.
►彼の言葉は今なお耳に残っている.　I can still hear ┏him saying it [his words].
・彼は 90 を過ぎてなおかくしゃくとしている.　He's 90 years old, but still vigorous [hale and hearty].
・春なお浅し.　Spring ┏has still hardly started [《文》 is not yet far advanced].
・容疑者はなお逃亡を続けている.　The suspect is still ┏free [on the run]. ｜ They still haven't caught the suspect.
・当地ではなお余震が続いている.　After-quakes are still going on here. ｜ There are still [We are still having] after shocks here.
2 〔さらに〕 more; 〔いっそう〕 further; still [even] more; 〔かえってもっと〕 all the more 《for [because]…》.
►なおもう一度　yet again
・なおいっそう悪いことには　to make matters even worse; (what is) worse still
・なおよいことには　to make things even better; (what is) still better
・なお大切なことは　still more importantly; (what is) still more important
・なおも考えたうえ　after further consideration; on thinking it over more carefully.
►このほうがなおよい.　This is ┏still better [even better, better still].
・締め切りまでにはなお2 週間ある.　There are still two weeks (to go) until the deadline.
・なお2, 3 の例を加えておこう.　Let's add two or three ┏more [other] examples.
・なおいっそうの努力が望まれる.　Still greater efforts are required.
・なおいっそうのごひいきをお願い申し上げます.　Do please continue to favor us with your patronage. ｜ We look forward to continuing to serve you.
・遅くてもかまわないが, 早ければなおよい.　If it takes time, so be it, but the sooner the better. ｜ It doesn't have to be done in a hurry, but if you can get it done quickly I'd be still more grateful.
・それがなくても困らないが, あればなおけっこうだ.　I can manage without it, but having it would be even better.
・この分野はなおコスト削減の余地がある.　There's still room for cost reduction in this area.
・電話もうっとうしいが, 訪ねてこられるのはなお迷惑だ.　Even being phoned is a pain; being visited is even worse.
・失敗したのも悪いが, それを隠していたのはなお悪い.　It's bad enough that he made a mistake; it's even worse that he covered it up.
・気持ちを言葉にすることは難しいが, それを人に伝えるのはなお難しい.　Putting one's feelings into words is difficult; conveying them to another person is ┏even [still] harder.
・彼は憎んでもなお余りあるやつだ.　I more than hate him; I utterly detest him.
・会えばなお恋しさがつのる.　Meeting her doesn't make me miss her any less. ｜ Far from assuaging my longing, meeting her simply makes it worse.
・飲めないと思うとなおのこと飲みたくなる.　Knowing I can't drink simply makes me want to drink even more.
・民間療法を試みてなおのこと症状を悪化させてしまった.　Trying a folk remedy simply made the symptoms ┏even [still] worse.
3 〔あたかも〕 as…; just like….
►葉の草木におけるはなお肺の動物におけるがごとくである.　Leaves are to the plant what lungs are to the animal. ｜ As lungs are to the animal, so are leaves to the plant.
・クジラの魚にあらざるはなお馬の魚にあらざるがごとし.　A whale is no more a fish than a horse is.
4 〔付け加えて言えば〕 furthermore; in addition.
►なおなお書き　⇒なおなお.
►なお日程については決まり次第お知らせします.　(Let me add that) we shall advise you as soon as the schedule is fixed.
・なお鈴木氏には当方から通知いたします.　I would like to add that we shall communicate direct with Mr. Suzuki.
・なお上に述べたことはみだりに口外せぬこと.　I wish to add that this information is to remain confidential. ｜ This information, I should add, should not be revealed to third parties.
・今日はこれで終わります. なお来週は都合により 1 時間早く始めさせていただきます.　That's all for today. Next week(, let me add,) we shall for various reasons start one hour earlier.

・この品種の馬をならすことは難しい.　This breed of horse is quite difficult to break in.

ならす３【慣らす・馴らす】 [ローマ字](narasu)
1 【慣らす】 〔違和感をなくす〕 accustom [acclimate] 《oneself》 to…; 〔日常とする〕 get 《oneself》 into the habit of….
►寒さに体を慣らす　inure oneself to cold
・新制度に頭を慣らす　acclimate oneself to the new system.
►こちらを顧客の考え方に慣らすしかない.　We've no choice but to adapt ourselves to our client's way of thinking.
・この程度の騒音には慣らされている.　I've become inured to this level of noise.
・妻の料理の味にすっかり慣らされてしまった.　I've been totally won over to my wife's cooking.
2 【慣らす】 〔使用のための準備をする〕 break [wear] in; ready (for use).
►(投球のために)肩を慣らす　warm [loosen] up one's (pitching) ┏arm [shoulder]
・(競走や登山のために)足を慣らす　loosen up one's ┏legs [leg muscles]
・英語に耳を慣らす　accustom the ear to English (sounds)
・プロの(投球の)スピードに目を慣らす　accustom one's (batting) eye to the speed of the pros
・新しい万年筆を手に慣らす　break in a new fountain pen
・新車に体を慣らす　get to feel comfortable in a new car.
3 【馴らす】 〔動物を訓練する〕 tame; domesticate; break in 《a horse》; make [reclaim] 《a hawk》; charm 《a snake》; gentle 《a wild pony》; train 《a dog》; 〔労役や芸をさせる〕 train 《an animal》to 《perform》.
►象をならして家畜にする　tame and domesticate an elephant
・犬をならして芸をさせる　train a dog to do tricks.
►この熊はよくならしてある.　This bear is quite tame.
・この品種の馬をならすことは難しい.　This breed of horse is quite difficult to break in.

ならす４【鳴らす】 [ローマ字](narasu)
1 〔音を立てさせる〕 ring 《a bell》; sound 《a trumpet》; chime 《bells》; clang 《a gong》; clank 《a heavy chain》; blow 《a whistle》; beat 《a drum》; jingle 《coins》; clap 《hands》; jangle 《a bunch of keys》; clink 《a glass》; crack 《a whip》; smack 《one's lips》; cluck 《one's tongue》.
►ベルを鳴らす　ring a bell; 〔玄関の〕 ring the doorbell
・呼び鈴を鳴らして受付を呼ぶ　ring (a counter bell) for the receptionist
・携帯電話を鳴らす　sound the call signal on a cellphone
・(自動車の)警笛を鳴らす　sound the ┏horn [honker]; toot [honk] the horn
・警鐘を鳴らす　⇒けいしょう１１
・バイオリンをきいきい鳴らす　scrape on a fiddle
・おいしそうな物を見てごくりとのどを鳴らす　give an audible gulp at the sight of something delicious.
►ピアノでドの音を鳴らしてください.　Let's hear you play "do" on the piano.
・風がこずえを鳴らした.　The wind ┏sighed [soughed] in the treetops.
2 〔評判を取る〕 be ┏widely [well] known; be famous; be popular; make a name for oneself.
►かつて名脇役として鳴らした俳優　an actor who was once well known for his (superb) supporting roles.
►父も若いころは俊足で鳴らした.　When young my father was quite famous as a speedster.
・彼はかつて起業家として鳴らしたものだ.　He's someone who once enjoyed considerable fame as an entrepreneur.
・彼女は当時作家として大いに鳴らしていた.　She enjoyed great popularity as a novelist at that time.
3 〔言い立てる〕
►不平を鳴らす　complain 《of…》; grumble 《at [about]…》; air one's grievances
・相手の非を鳴らす　complain of [denounce] the other's transgression(s).

ならう１【倣う】 [ローマ字](narau)
imitate; follow; emulate; model oneself 《on [after]…》; copy 《sb's good points》; follow in sb's footsteps; take one's cue from sb.
►先例に倣う　follow [emulate] a precedent
・先人に倣う　copy [model oneself after] one's predecessor
・手本に倣う　copy ┏from [after] a model
・例に倣う　follow an example
・先輩のやり方に倣う　follow the example of one's seniors
・…に倣って　after…; after the ┏example [model, fashion, style] of…; in [after] the manner of…; on [along] the lines of…; in imitation of…
・…に倣ってこしらえる　make sth ┏after the pattern [on the model] of…; model sth after…
・イギリスに倣った法律制度　a legal system based on the British model.
►他の大都市もこれに倣っている.　The practice is being taken up in other large cities.
・日本はカリフォルニアに倣って六・三制を設けた.　Japan has followed the example of California in establishing the 6-3 system of education.
・わが社が賛成すれば他社もそれに倣うだろう.　If our company agrees, the others will follow suit.
・上の好むところ下これに倣う.　What the upper classes prefer the lower at once imitate.
・以下これに倣う.　The rest to follow this example.
・お茶席は初めてだが, 隣の人に倣って同じようにしていれば何とかなるだろう.　I've never taken part in the tea ceremony before, but if I follow the lead of the person next to me, I suppose I can't go far wrong.
・右[左]へ倣え(, 右[左]).　〔号令〕 Dress ┏right [left](, dress)!
・この種の番組の視聴率が上がったからと言って何でも右に倣えでは, 各テレビ局の独自性が出てこない.　If each TV station just ┏follows suit [plays follow-the-leader] when this kind of TV program's rating have climbed, we won't see any originality from the TV stations.

ならう２【習う】 [ローマ字](narau)
〔学習する〕 learn; be taught; take lessons in 《Latin》; study; 〔練習する〕 practice; get training in 《swordsmanship》.
►ピアノを習う　take lessons on the piano
・水泳を習う　take swimming lessons
・お茶を習う　learn the tea ceremony
・自動車の運転を習う　learn how to drive a car
・料理を習う　take cooking lessons
・父に将棋を習う　learn shōgi from one's father
・祖父にそばの打ち方を習う　learn how to make buckwheat noodles from one's grandfather
・5 歳のとき初めて踊りを習う　receive one's first dancing instruction at the age of five
・習わせる　get 《one's daughter》 to take lessons in 《English》; get sb to learn 《swimming》; train 《a girl》 in 《classical ballet》.
►中国人について中国語を習った.　I ┏studied Chinese under [learned Chinese from] a Chinese.
・彼女は声楽をイタリア人の先生に習っている.　She is taking singing lessons from an Italian teacher.
・柔道ではまず受け身を習った.　The first thing I learned in judo was how to take falls.
・今日は学校で何を習ったの?　What did you learn in school today?
・習うより慣れよ.　Practice [Use] makes perfect. 【諺】 ｜ Learn by doing.

ならわし【習わし】 [ローマ字](narawashi)
〔風習〕 a custom; a practice; a usage; the usual way; 〔伝統〕 tradition; 〔因襲〕 convention; 〔習慣〕 a habit; a way. [⇒しゅうかん５, ならい]
►世の習わし　the way(s) of the world

►習わしどおりに　true to the tradition.
►大昔からの習わしで　according to immemorial custom.
►古くからの土地の習わしに従う　conform to time-honored local custom

なれあい【馴れ合い】 [ローマ字](nareai)

なれなれしい【馴れ馴れしい】 [ローマ字](narenareshii)
familiar; overfamiliar; unceremonious; too free.
►なれなれしい態度で　with an air of familiarity; with too much familiarity
・なれなれしい口調で　in a (too) familiar tone
・なれなれしい口をきく　talk in an overly familiar tone; speak in a presumptuous ┏manner [way].
►会ったばかりだというのに妙になれなれしい男だった.　He was a little too friendly for somebody I'd just met.
・彼女の話し方は気さくと言うよりなれなれしくて不快だ.　Her manner of speech was more than friendly, it was repellently overfamiliar.
・私に話しかけてくるあいつの態度, なれなれしいったらありゃしない.　He's got no right to address me in such an overfamiliar manner.
なれなれしく　in a friendly manner; familiarly; unceremoniously.
►知らない男がいきなりなれなれしく話しかけてきた.　A man I didn't know suddenly addressed me with familiarity.
なれなれしくする　be [make] familiar 《with…》.
►あまりなれなれしくしすぎる　be overfamiliar 《with…》; take liberties 《with…》; *get fresh 《with a woman》
・あまりなれなれしくすると人に嫌われる.　Undue familiarity will breed dislike.

・彼はだれにもなれなれしくする.　He is hail-fellow-well-met with everybody.
なれなれしさ　overfamiliarity; lack of ceremony.

なれる２【慣れる・馴れる】 [ローマ字](nareru)
1 【慣れる】 〔日常になる〕 become familiar 《with…》; grow accustomed 《to…》; get used 《to…》; 〔違和感がなくなる〕 inure oneself 《to…》; habituate oneself 《to…》; grow accustomed 《to…》.
►新しい土地に慣れる　habituate oneself to a new climate
・新しい環境[職場]に慣れる　acclimate [acclimatize] oneself to a new ┏environment [place of work]
・土地の習慣に慣れる　become familiar with the local customs
・北海道の寒さに慣れる　become inured to the cold of Hokkaidō
・満員電車に慣れる　get used to riding in overcrowded trains
・早起きに慣れる　grow accustomed to rising early
・(新しい靴が)足に慣れる　get broken in
・新しい通貨に慣れる　become familiar with a new currency
・慣れないタキシード姿で　in the unaccustomed costume of a tuxedo.
►私はこんなことには慣れている.　I have some experience in these things.
・彼はどうも新しい水に慣れなかった.　Somehow he could not adjust to his new surroundings.
・人間はどんな不幸な状況にも慣れてしまうものだ.　Human beings can inure themselves to any hardship.
・「夜勤は大変でしょうね」「いえ, 慣れてますから」　"It must be rough being on night shift."―"No, I'm used to it."
・独り暮らしにはもう慣れましたか.　Have you settled in to living on your own?
・彼はアメリカの生活にとうとう慣れることができなかった.　He was ultimately unable to accustom himself to life in America.
・慣れたころには次の任地へ引っ越しだ.　Just when I've gotten accustomed to one post, it's time to move to another.
・そこは通勤路だから慣れた道だ.　I know that road backwards and forwards because I take it every day to work.
・試合の前に競技場に慣れておく必要がある.　You must get a feel for the arena before the competition.
・この料理はすごく辛いけど慣れるとおいしいよ.　This food is really hot, but it tastes great once you're used to it.
・彼女のフランス語なまりの英語にようやく慣れてきた.　I've finally gotten used to her French-accented English.
・彼の不作法にはこちらが慣れるしかない.　We can only accustom ourselves to his bad manners.
2 【慣れる】 〔使えるようになる〕 become able to ┏use [manipulate] sth; 〔物などになじむ〕 get familiarized 《with sth》.
►暗やみに目が慣れてきた.　My eyes adapted to the dark.
・耳が慣れていないのでネイティヴの話す英語が聞き取れない.　I'm not used to hearing it, so I can't follow native speakers' English.
・慣れたペンでないとうまく書けない.　I can't write well unless the pen is familiar.
・ようやく慣れたころに新しいパソコンに買い換えざるを得なくなった.　I had to buy a new PC just when I'd finally gotten comfortable using my old one.
・新しい携帯の操作にはなかなか慣れることができない.　I simply cannot get the knack of using a new ┏cellphone [mobile phone].
3 【慣れる】 〔仕事などを熟知する〕 master; become proficient; 〔熟練する〕 become experienced 《at…》; become skilled 《at…》.
►経理に慣れる　become expert at accounting
・赤ん坊の扱いに慣れる　become a veteran at taking care of babies
・慣れた手つきで　skilfully; with ┏practiced [clever] hands
・慣れない手つきで箸(はし)を使う　use chopsticks awkwardly; be awkward in handling chopsticks.
►慣れないことはしないほうがよい.　Don't do it unless you know what you're doing.
・この計算は慣れないうちは間違えやすい.　It's easy to make mistakes in this calculation until you are more proficient.
・さすがに慣れたものだ.　That shows his experience.
・彼はその仕事に慣れている.　He is broken in to the work.
・製本は(その仕事に)慣れたところに頼んだほうがよい.　Bookbinding is best done by an expert firm.
・彼は通訳なら慣れたものだ.　He is an old hand at interpreting. ｜ He is a seasoned interpreter.
4 【馴れる】 〔動物や鳥が人になつく〕 become tame.
►なれていない　〔なついていない〕 untamed; tameless; wild; 〔家畜化されていない〕 undomesticated
・なれにくい　tameless; (すぐこわがる) shy.
►カラスでもなれればかわいい.　Even a crow is lovable if it is tame.
・子スズメはよく(人に)なれるそうだ.　Young sparrows are said to tame easily.
・このライオンは人になれている.　This lion is tame.
・この馬は私にだけなれている.　This horse is only broken in for me.
・成獣は人になかなかなれない.　Mature beasts are not easily tamed.

・試合の前に競技場に慣れておく必要がある.　You must get a feel for the arena before the competition.
・この料理はすごく辛いけど慣れるとおいしいよ.　This food is really hot, but it tastes great once you're used to it.
・彼女のフランス語なまりの英語にようやく慣れてきた.　I've finally gotten used to her French-accented English.
・彼の不作法にはこちらが慣れるしかない.　We can only accustom ourselves to his bad manners.
2 【慣れる】 〔使えるようになる〕 become able to ┏use [manipulate] sth; 〔物などになじむ〕 get familiarized 《with sth》.
►暗やみに目が慣れてきた.　My eyes adapted to the dark.
・耳が慣れていないのでネイティヴの話す英語が聞き取れない.　I'm not used to hearing it, so I can't follow native speakers' English.
・慣れたペンでないとうまく書けない.　I can't write well unless the pen is familiar.
・ようやく慣れたころに新しいパソコンに買い換えざるを得なくなった.　I had to buy a new PC just when I'd finally gotten comfortable using my old one.
・新しい携帯の操作にはなかなか慣れることができない.　I simply cannot get the knack of using a new ┏cellphone [mobile phone].
3 【慣れる】 〔仕事などを熟知する〕 master; become proficient; 〔熟練する〕 become experienced 《at…》; become skilled 《at…》.
►経理に慣れる　become expert at accounting
・赤ん坊の扱いに慣れる　become a veteran at taking care of babies
・慣れた手つきで　skilfully; with ┏practiced [clever] hands
・慣れない手つきで箸(はし)を使う　use chopsticks awkwardly; be awkward in handling chopsticks.
►慣れないことはしないほうがよい.　Don't do it unless you know what you're doing.
・この計算は慣れないうちは間違えやすい.　It's easy to make mistakes in this calculation until you are more proficient.
・さすがに慣れたものだ.　That shows his experience.
・彼はその仕事に慣れている.　He is broken in to the work.
・製本は(その仕事に)慣れたところに頼んだほうがよい.　Bookbinding is best done by an expert firm.
・彼は通訳なら慣れたものだ.　He is an old hand at interpreting. ｜ He is a seasoned interpreter.
4 【馴れる】 〔動物や鳥が人になつく〕 become tame.
►なれていない　〔なついていない〕 untamed; tameless; wild; 〔家畜化されていない〕 undomesticated
・なれにくい　tameless; (すぐこわがる) shy.
►カラスでもなれればかわいい.　Even a crow is lovable if it is tame.
・子スズメはよく(人に)なれるそうだ.　Young sparrows are said to tame easily.
・このライオンは人になれている.　This lion is tame.
・この馬は私にだけなれている.　This horse is only broken in for me.
・成獣は人になかなかなれない.　Mature beasts are not easily tamed.

・不等式が成り立つx の値　the values of x for which the inequality holds.
►その本は十の章から成り立っている.　The book consists of ten chapters.
・フィリピンは大小多数の島から成り立つ.　The Philippines are made up of a great number of islands, large and small.
・この国の社会はさまざまな民族の出身者で成り立っている.　Society in this country is comprised of members of a wide variety of ethnic groups.
・出席者は会議がぎりぎり成り立つ人数だった.　There were just enough attendees to constitute a quorum for the meeting.
・そうか, そういう考え方も成り立つかもしれないね.　Yes, that point of view may well be valid, too.
・…については次の関係が成り立つ.　The following relation ┏holds [applies] for….
・この場合も同じ物理理論が成り立つ.　The same physical theory also applies in this case.
・その逆も成り立つ.　The reverse 《of the proposition》 is also true.
・そう一方的にまくしたてては議論が成り立たないよ.　If you rant [With you ranting] on and on like that, it doesn't make for a discussion.
・それでは商売が成り立たない.　There is no commercial profit in that. ｜ That way the business does not pay.
・君の説は成り立たない.　Your theory does not hold good.
・金持ちだから幸福だという理屈は成り立たない.　Because one is rich it does not follow that one is happy.
・特異点では物理法則は成り立たなくなる.　The laws of physics break down at a singularity.

なりゆき【成り行き】 [ローマ字](nariyuki)
〔経過〕 the course 《of events》; the development 《of an affair》; the progress 《of inquiries》; 〔推移〕 the turn 《of events》; 〔結果〕 the issue 《of a war》; the consequence 《of one's doing》; the outcome 《of a matter》; 〔運命〕 the destiny 《of a man》.

►なりゆきに任せる　leave 《a matter》 to ┏take [run, follow] its own [natural] course; allow 《the situation》 to ┏develop in its own way [make its own development]; leave 《an affair》 ┏alone [unchecked]; let 《things》 ┏ride [slide]; ride [drift] with the tide; trust to chance; resign [abandon] oneself to fate; take 《things》 as they come
・なりゆきに任せよう.　Let things ride.

►なりゆきを待つ[見る]　watch the ┏course [development] of events; wait for the turn of events; await the issue of events; wait and see how things will turn out; adopt a wait-and-see policy; sit on the fence; watch which way the cat jumps
・なりゆきを見たうえで決めよう.　Let us see how things turn out before we decide.
・不安げに[熱心に]なりゆきを見守る　anxiously [eagerly] watch how things go
・なりゆきを見守ろう.　Let us watch its development.
・なりゆきを見定める　wait for the ultimate outcome
・世界じゅうがかたずをのんで争いのなりゆきを注目している.　The whole world is watching the development of the conflict with bated breath.
・わが国の態度が今後の世界経済のなりゆきを左右するだろう.　Our national position will likely influence the future course of the world economy.
►なりゆきは依然不透明だ.　Its further course is still uncertain.

なる３【為る】 [ローマ字](naru)
1 〔自然現象で〕 become; turn 《into…》; develop [grow] 《into…》; 〔年齢が〕 attain; reach; turn.
►大人になる　become an adult; grow up
・老人になる　grow elderly; become an old ┏man [woman].

・お風呂のお湯が水になってしまった.　The bath water has grown cold.
・雨は夜半から雪になった.　The rain turned to snow in the night.
・イモムシはやがてチョウになった.　The caterpillar eventually turned into a butterfly.
・爬虫類(はちゅうるい)が進化して鳥になった.　Reptiles evolved into birds.
・クジラは前肢がひれになっている.　The forelimbs of the whale have developed into fins.
・傷はかさぶたになった.　A scab formed over the wound.
・風で書類が裏返しになった.　The papers were turned upside-down by the wind.
・彼女は 16 歳になったばかりだ.　She's only just turned sixteen.
・心労のあまり一晩で白髪になったという話をよく聞く.　I often hear someone's hair has turned white overnight as a result of anxiety.
2 〔(成り行きで)変わる〕 become; develop; come to be; 〔結果として〕 turn out; work out; end up; 〔決まる〕 be decided 《to do》; be settled.
►金持ちになる　become [get] rich; make oneself rich
・犠牲になる　fall a victim 《to…》
・病気になる　fall [be taken] ill
・酒を飲むようになる　turn into a drinker; take to drinking.
►私はそうなると困る.　If that happens I'm out of luck.
・話題が政治になるとついていけない.　I can't keep up when the discussion turns to politics.
・どっちに転んでも君の損になる.　You will lose, whichever happens.
・その仕事は金になる.　That work will be profitable.
・景気はこの先どうなるのだろう.　I wonder what the economy will do from now on?
・なるようになるさ.　What will be will be.
・どうあがいたところでなるようにしかならない.　No matter what we do, the result will be the same. ｜ Nothing we do will make any difference.
・なるようになれ.　Let things take their course.
・ええい, もうどうにでもなれ.　Who cares how it turns out?
・そちらのご迷惑になりませんか.　Would it be any problem for you?
・こんなことになろうとは思わなかった.　I never expected things would ┏come to this [end up like this].
・父は胃を手術することになった.　It was determined that my father would have an operation on his stomach.
・会議には掘さんが出ることになった.　It was decided that Mr. Hori would attend the meeting.
・ここが私の席ということになった.　It turned out that my seat is here.
・締め切りは明日ということになった.　The deadline was set for tomorrow.
・朝の散歩が習慣になっている.　My morning walk has grown into a habit.
・私の夢は現実になった.　My dream came true.
・幼い妹は最近自転車に乗れるようになった.　My baby sister recently learned how to ride a bicycle.
・こうなったからには私も覚悟を決めよう.　Now that it has come to this I shall put aside my misgivings.
3 〔取り決め・規則などで〕 be in [come into] effect; change (over) 《to…》.
►新制度になる　change over to a new system.

・わが社は来週は 3 連休になる.　Next week the company will be closed for three days in a row.
・2002 年, ヨーロッパの通貨がユーロになった.　The Euro became Europe's currency in 2002.
・この空き地は公園になるそうだ.　This empty lot is supposed to become a park.
・この店も年中無休になった.　This store is now open all year-round too.
・多摩川を越えると神奈川県になる.　When you cross the Tama you'll be in Kanagawa Prefecture.
・book に s をつけると複数形になる.　When you add an "s" to "book" it becomes plural.
・man の複数形は men になる.　The plural of "man" is "men."
・Baseball は日本では「野球」になる.　"Baseball" is "yakyū" in Japan.
・よし! 彼女と同じクラスになったぞ.　All right! I'm going to be in the same class as her!

►信号が青になった.　The light turned green.
・掃除当番が私の番になった.　It was my turn for cleaning duty.

・会社員になる　become a company employee

►君には私たちとともに戦う同志になってほしい.　We want you to become our comrade in the struggle.
・きょうは私が運転手になろう.　I'll be the driver today.
・病人になってほんとうの痛みがわかった.　I learned what pain was really like after I became ill.

・娘は小学生になった.　My daughter started elementary school.

6 〔ある時点や時期に〕 become [get to be] 《nighttime》.
►食事の時間になる　get to be mealtime
・冬になる　become winter

►年末になると何かと忙しい.　We're busy with a lot of things when year-end comes around.
・21 世紀になった.　It has become the 21st century.
・春になって夏になってやがて 1 年が過ぎていく.　Spring comes, then summer in its turn, until at ┏length [last] a year goes by.

・体重が(増えて)60 キロになった.　My weight is up to 60 kilos.
8 〔ある形状である〕

10 〔役割を果たす〕 be; be used for sth.

・将来のためになる　be of use for the future.

なる４【鳴る】 [ローマ字](naru)
1 〔音を立てる〕 sound; make a sound; (鈴・鐘が) peal; (雷が) roll; (きしんで) creak; 〔音が感じられる〕 sound [ring] in one's ear; 〔反響する〕 resound; echo.

・外では雷がゴロゴロ鳴っていた.　Thunder was rumbling outside.
・ドアがギイと鳴った.　The door creaked.
・ドンドンと花火が鳴った.　Fireworks boomed.
・ポケットで小銭がジャラジャラ鳴っている.　Change is jingling in my pocket.

・出帆の時には汽笛が鳴る.　The ship's whistle blows when it is time to set sail.
・あなたの携帯が鳴っていますよ.　It's your mobile phone that's ringing.
・この電話は朝から鳴りっぱなしだ.　This phone hasn't stopped ringing since this morning.
・風で電線が鳴っている.　The wind is humming in the wires.
・ファンファーレが高らかに鳴った.　The fanfare trumpeted loudly.
・(時計の)9 時が鳴った.　The clock has struck nine.

・なるべく酒量を控えるように.　Reduce your alcohol consumption as much as possible.

・借金はなるべくしないようにしている.　I borrow no more money than I can help. ｜ I don't borrow if I can help it.
・今はなるべくそっとしておいてあげなさい.　For now please leave her alone as far as possible.
・なるべくなら明日は休みたいのですが.　If possible, I'd like to have tomorrow off.
・連絡は電話かメールで, なるべくならメールでください.　Please contact me by phone or e-mail―preferably e-mail.
・なるべくならこちらが欲しい.　If I had my druthers, I'd prefer this (one).
・なるべくならこのことは言いたくなかったのですが.　I would have preferred not to mention this.
・なるべく早くご返事ください.　Please reply at your earliest convenience. ｜ Please let me have your answer ┏as soon as possible [ASAP, asap].

なぜ【何故】 [ローマ字](naze)
〔理由〕 why; how; for what ┏reason [purpose]; 《口》 what for; 《口》 how come; 〔根拠〕 on what ┏ground(s) [authority]. [⇒なぜか, なぜなら(ば)]
►それがなぜそうなのか説明する[知っている]　explain [know] why it is so
・なぜ…かといえば[いうと]…(だ)からだ.　The reason (why)…is because….
►なぜそうなるの.　Why (is that) so? ｜ How (does it work out to be) so? ｜ How come?
・なぜでしょう.　Why is that?
・「ここにいてください」「なぜ?」　"You stay here."―"Why?"
・「それは言えません」「なぜ?」　"One can't say that."―"Why not?"
・「なぜ?」「知らない」　"Why?"―"I don't know."
・なぜ来なかったの. 待ってたのに.　Why didn't you come? I waited and waited.
・なぜ私が辞めなきゃいかんのだ.　Why am I the one who has to resign?
・なぜあんなことをしたのか.　Whyever did you do such a thing? ｜ What made you do so?
・「なぜ行くの」「なぜだっていいじゃないか」　"Whyever are you going?"―"What difference does it make?"
・彼はなぜ行ってしまったのだろう.　I wonder why he left.
・なぜ人は憎み合うのだろう.　Why do people hate one another?
・彼があの時なぜ赤くなったか知ってる?　Do you know why he turned red in the face then?
・なぜこういうことになったのか説明したまえ.　Explain to me exactly how things came to this pretty pass?
・なぜ笑われたのか見当もつかない.　I don't have any idea why I was laughed at (that way).
・なぜあんなに叱ったかといえば, それはお前を心配しているからなんだよ.　The reason I scolded you that way is because I'm worried about you.

なぜか【何故か】 [ローマ字](nazeka)

ねだん【値段】 [ローマ字](nedan)
a price; a cost; a figure. [⇒ね３, かかく２, そうば 1]
►妥当な値段　a ┏moderate [reasonable] price
・ぎりぎり最低の値段　the lowest price possible; a rock-bottom price
・引き合う値段　a ┏workable [paying] price
・買い気をそそるような値段　a tempting price
・目の玉の飛び出るような[法外な, 途方もない]値段　an astronomical [an exorbitant, an extortionate, a staggering, a prohibitive, a stiff] price
・高い値段　a ┏high [tall, fancy] price
・安い値段　a low [an economical, a cheap] price
・送料込みの値段　the price with ┏postage [freight charges] included.
►値段だけの価値がある　be worth the ┏price [money]
・値段と相談で　if the price is ┏satisfactory [reasonable, moderate, within bounds].
►値段が上がる　the price ┏rises [goes up]; 〈品物が主語〉 rise [increase, advance, go up] in price; be on the rise
・土地の値段が下がればいいのだが.　Wouldn't it be nice if ┏land prices [the price of land] fell [went down, declined]?
・中東情勢が悪化すれば石油の値段が急騰するだろう.　If the situation in the Middle East worsens, oil prices will probably ┏skyrocket [shoot up].
・土地の値段が急落している.　Land prices are ┏plummeting [plunging].
・(品物の)値段が高い[張る]　be expensive; be high in price; be high-priced
・(品物の)値段が安い[張らない]　be inexpensive; be low in price; be low-priced; be cheap; be ┏moderately [reasonably] priced
・この方が値段が安い[高い].　This is ┏less [more] expensive.
・その方は少々お値段が張ります.　That one is a little higher in price. ｜ That one costs a little more.
・値段が高すぎる.　Your price is too ┏high [stiff]. ｜ You ask too much. ｜ That's too expensive. ｜ It's overpriced.
・値段が高いからといって品がいいとは限らない.　A high price does not necessarily assure good quality.
・長い押し問答の末, 値段がまとまった.　After much haggling, a price was agreed on.
・彼が出品した古陶にいい値段がついた.　The old pot he put up for auction sold for a ┏high [good] price.
・値段が折り合わず, 契約は不成立に終わった.　Agreement wasn't reached on a price and the contract went unsigned.
・骨董(こっとう)品は値段があってないようなものだ.　The price of an antique can be influenced by subjective valuation.
►安い[高い]値段で　at a ┏low [high] price; 《buy an article》 cheap [dear]
・その品は結構な値段で売れたよ.　I got a good price for that.
・その国有地は不当に安い値段で払い下げられた.　That piece of public property was sold off at an unjustifiably low price.
・全部込みの値段で　at an all-inclusive price; ᐦat an all-in rate
・若い人でも買える値段で発売する　go on sale at a price within the reach of young people
・その値段では元がとれません.　Your figure is below cost. ｜ We will lose money if we sell it at that figure.
・おっしゃる値段では当方は買えません.　We cannot buy on the terms you mentioned.
・その値段で手を打ちましょう.　At that price it's a deal.
・当店はあくまでも品質と値段で勝負します.　It is our unvarying policy to compete on the basis of quality and cost.
・マスクメロン 1 個の値段で西瓜なら 3 個買える.　You can buy three watermelons for the price of a single muskmelon.
►国産品と輸入品では値段に差がある.　There's a price differential between domestic and imported goods.
・10 年前の値段に引き下げる　reduce the price to what it was ten years ago.
►値段の交渉　price negotiation
・国産品と輸入品の値段の開き　the difference in price between domestic and imported goods
・その土地は値段の折り合いがつかなくて売れなかった.　A price couldn't be agreed on and the land went unsold.
・手ごろな値段の品物　affordable [reasonably priced] items of merchandise.
►値段を聞く　ask the price 《of an article》; price 《an article at a store》
・値段をつける　〔買い手が〕 make an offer 《of \3,000》 for 《an article》; name one's price; 〔売り手が〕 price [tag] 《an article at \5,000》; mark the price on 《an article》; 〔値ぶみする〕 set [put] a price on 《an article》; appraise; evaluate; estimate
・値段を安くつける　put a low price on sth
・法外な値段を吹っかける　ask [demand, name] an extravagant price 《for…》
・値段をつり上げる　raise [put up, 《口》 jack up] the price
・値段を 2 割引き上げる　raise the price by 20 percent
・値段を下げる　lower [cut back, slash] the price
・値段を 1,000 円から 800 円に引き下げる　lower the price from \1,000 to \800
・値段を 1000 円以下に抑える　hold [keep] the price at or below \1,000
・値段を据え置く　hold the price at the present rate
・値段を掛けあう　bargain [haggle] over the price 《of an article》 (with sb)
・たくさん買ったら値段をまけてくれますか.　If I buy in quantity will you ┏reduce the price [give me a discount]?
・ご希望の値段をおっしゃってください.　Give [Quote] me a price at which you're willing to make a purchase.
►値段はいくらですか.　How much ┏is it [does it cost]? ｜ How much are you asking for it? ｜ What is the price of this?
・値段は 1 個 500 円から 1,000 円までいろいろです.　Prices range from \500 (up) to \1,000 per item.
・お求めやすいよう値段はできるだけ抑えてあります.　We're holding the price down to keep it within our customers' reach.
・値段は 100 グラム 500 円からある.　Prices start at \500 for 100 grams.
・まるでただみたいな値段だ.　At that price they're almost giving it away.
・背広の値段はピンからキリまである.　There's a wide price range for men's suits.
・お値段はどのくらいのものをお望みでしょうか.　What price range are you considering?
・同じ値段なら国産のものを買う.　If the price is the same, I'll buy domestic.
◨運賃保険料込み値段　a CIF price.
現場渡し値段　a loco [an ex-factory] price.
仕入れ[倉庫渡し, 定価表記載]値段　a cost [an ex-warehouse, a list] price.
諸掛かり込み[突込み]値段　an all-round price.
仲間値段　a trade [an inside, an insider's] price.
成り行き値段　⇒なりゆき.
本船渡し値段　a free-on-board [an f.o.b.] price.
◧値段設定　pricing.
値段づけ　pricing; tagging.
値段表　a price list; 〔カタログ〕 a priced catalogue.

ねがい【願い】 [ローマ字](negai)
1 〔願望〕 a desire; a wish; a longing; an aspiration; a hope.
►叶わぬ[届かぬ]願い　an unfulfilled [a vain] desire; an unachieved [a fruitless] aspiration; an unattained [a futile] wish
・到底むりな願い　an impossible dream
・切実な願い　an urgent desire
・心からの願い　one's ┏heart's desire [dearest wish]; a deep [a profound] longing
・ひそかな願い　one's ┏secret [unspoken] desire; a mute longing
・永年の願い　a long-held desire; one's aspiration for many years.
►彼の願いがかなった[届いた].　He has had his desire fulfilled. ｜ He got his wish. ｜ His wish ┏came true [has been fulfilled, was realized]. ｜ His ship came in.
►日ごろの願いを実現させる　have one's cherished ┏hope [desire] fulfilled; realize a cherished wish
・短冊に願いを込めて笹竹につるす　write one's aspiration on a slip of paper and hang it on a bamboo branch.
►私の願いはそれだけです.　That's my one desire. ｜ That is all I ┏pray [wish] for.
・私たちの願いはただ一つ, この平和がずっと続きますように.　Our one wish is that these peaceful times last forever.
・美しい自然は人類共通の願いである.　All people desire a beautiful natural world.
・彼らの願いはたぶんかなわないだろう.　I doubt that they will realize their desire. ｜ I don't think their wish will come true.
・選挙はわれわれの願いどおりの結果になった.　The election yielded the results we had hoped for. ｜ The election results ┏fulfilled [measured up to] our expectations. ｜ We got everything we wanted from the election.
2 〔依頼〕 a desire; a request; 〔懇願〕 an appeal; an entreaty; a solicitation. [⇒おねがい]
►私たちのたっての願いで彼はやってきた.　He came at our urgent request.
►切なる願いに応えて　in response to an ┏earnest [urgent] request
・願により本職を免ずる.　〔辞令の文言〕 Discharged from his position [Allowed to resign] at his request.
►願いを聞き届ける[聞き入れる]　grant [comply with] ┏a [sb's] request
・私の願いを聞くだけでも聞いてください.　All I ask is that you listen to my request.
・願いを聞き入れない　refuse sb's request; refuse (to do) sb a favor
・願いを却下する　reject [turn down] sb's request
・願いを 3 つかなえてあげよう.　I'll give you three wishes. ｜ You shall have three requests.
►君からの願いとあれば何でも聞こう.　I can refuse you nothing. ｜ I can't say no to you.
・彼女の必死の願いは容れられた[容れられなかった].　Her desperate plea was ┏answered [refused].
・これが最後のお願いです.　This is the last request I will ever make of you.
3 〔出願〕 an application; 〔請願〕 a petition.
►彼は願いによって職を免ぜられた.　He was relieved of this post at his own request.
►願いを出す　present [file, submit] a petition 《for…》
・願い(の筋)を聞き入れる　grant a petition
・願いを却下する　refuse [reject, turn down] a ┏petition [request].
4 〔祈願〕 a prayer; a supplication. [⇒がん４]
►願いがかなう　have one's prayer ┏answered [heard]; one's prayer is ┏answered [heard]
・私の願いが届いて翌日は晴れた.　My prayers were answered and the weather the next day was sunny.
►神に願いをかける　pray to [supplicate] the gods 《for help》.
►家族の願いもむなしく彼は助からなかった.　The prayers of his family went unanswered and he died.

ねもと【根元・根本】 [ローマ字](nemoto)

►髪の毛の根元に養毛剤を擦り込む　rub hair tonic into one's hair roots.
